00358 /********************************************************************\

00360 *            Shared Memory Allocation                                *
00361 *                                                                    *

00364 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00365 void *malloc_key(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, INT size)
00366 {
00367    FREE_DESCRIP *pfree, *pfound, *pprev = NULL;
00368 
00369    if (size == 0)
00370       return NULL;
00371 
00372    /* quadword alignment for alpha CPU */
00373    size = ALIGN8(size);
00374 
00375    /* search for free block */
00376    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key);
00377 
00378    while (pfree->size < size && pfree->next_free) {
00379       pprev = pfree;
00380       pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00381    }
00382 
00383    /* return if not enough memory */
00384    if (pfree->size < size)
00385       return 0;
00386 
00387    pfound = pfree;
00388 
00389    /* if found block is first in list, correct pheader */
00390    if (pfree == (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key)) {
00391       if (size < pfree->size) {
00392          /* free block is only used partially */
00393          pheader->first_free_key += size;
00394          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key);
00395 
00396          pfree->size = pfound->size - size;
00397          pfree->next_free = pfound->next_free;
00398       } else {
00399          /* free block is used totally */
00400          pheader->first_free_key = pfree->next_free;
00401       }
00402    } else {
00403       /* check if free block is used totally */
00404       if (pfound->size - size < sizeof(FREE_DESCRIP)) {
00405          /* skip block totally */
00406          pprev->next_free = pfound->next_free;
00407       } else {
00408          /* decrease free block */
00409          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pfound + size);
00410 
00411          pfree->size = pfound->size - size;
00412          pfree->next_free = pfound->next_free;
00413 
00414          pprev->next_free = (PTYPE) pfree - (PTYPE) pheader;
00415       }
00416    }
00417 
00418 
00419    memset(pfound, 0, size);
00420 
00421    return pfound;
00422 }
00423 
00424 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00425 void free_key(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, void *address, INT size)
00426 {
00427    FREE_DESCRIP *pfree, *pprev, *pnext;
00428 
00429    if (size == 0)
00430       return;
00431 
00432    /* quadword alignment for alpha CPU */
00433    size = ALIGN8(size);
00434 
00435    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) address;
00436    pprev = NULL;
00437 
00438    /* clear current block */
00439    memset(address, 0, size);
00440 
00441    /* if key comes before first free block, adjust pheader */
00442    if ((PTYPE) address - (PTYPE) pheader < pheader->first_free_key) {
00443       pfree->size = size;
00444       pfree->next_free = pheader->first_free_key;
00445       pheader->first_free_key = (PTYPE) address - (PTYPE) pheader;
00446    } else {
00447       /* find last free block before current block */
00448       pprev = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key);
00449 
00450       while (pprev->next_free < (PTYPE) address - (PTYPE) pheader) {
00451          if (pprev->next_free <= 0) {
00452             cm_msg(MERROR, "free_key",
00453                    "database is corrupted: pprev=0x%x, pprev->next_free=%d",
00454                    pprev, pprev->next_free);
00455             return;
00456          }
00457          pprev = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pprev->next_free);
00458       }
00459 
00460       pfree->size = size;
00461       pfree->next_free = pprev->next_free;
00462 
00463       pprev->next_free = (PTYPE) pfree - (PTYPE) pheader;
00464    }
00465 
00466    /* try to melt adjacent free blocks after current block */
00467    pnext = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00468    if ((PTYPE) pnext == (PTYPE) pfree + pfree->size) {
00469       pfree->size += pnext->size;
00470       pfree->next_free = pnext->next_free;
00471 
00472       memset(pnext, 0, pnext->size);
00473    }
00474 
00475    /* try to melt adjacent free blocks before current block */
00476    if (pprev && pprev->next_free == (PTYPE) pprev - (PTYPE) pheader + pprev->size) {
00477       pprev->size += pfree->size;
00478       pprev->next_free = pfree->next_free;
00479 
00480       memset(pfree, 0, pfree->size);
00481    }
00482 }
00483 
00484 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00485 void *malloc_data(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, INT size)
00486 {
00487    FREE_DESCRIP *pfree, *pfound, *pprev = NULL;
00488 
00489    if (size == 0)
00490       return NULL;
00491 
00492    /* quadword alignment for alpha CPU */
00493    size = ALIGN8(size);
00494 
00495    /* search for free block */
00496    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data);
00497 
00498    while (pfree->size < size && pfree->next_free) {
00499       pprev = pfree;
00500       pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00501    }
00502 
00503    /* return if not enough memory */
00504    if (pfree->size < size)
00505       return 0;
00506 
00507    pfound = pfree;
00508 
00509    /* if found block is first in list, correct pheader */
00510    if (pfree == (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data)) {
00511       if (size < pfree->size) {
00512          /* free block is only used partially */
00513          pheader->first_free_data += size;
00514          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data);
00515 
00516          pfree->size = pfound->size - size;
00517          pfree->next_free = pfound->next_free;
00518       } else {
00519          /* free block is used totally */
00520          pheader->first_free_data = pfree->next_free;
00521       }
00522    } else {
00523       /* check if free block is used totally */
00524       if (pfound->size - size < sizeof(FREE_DESCRIP)) {
00525          /* skip block totally */
00526          pprev->next_free = pfound->next_free;
00527       } else {
00528          /* decrease free block */
00529          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pfound + size);
00530 
00531          pfree->size = pfound->size - size;
00532          pfree->next_free = pfound->next_free;
00533 
00534          pprev->next_free = (PTYPE) pfree - (PTYPE) pheader;
00535       }
00536    }
00537 
00538    /* zero memeory */
00539    memset(pfound, 0, size);
00540 
00541    return pfound;
00542 }
00543 
00544 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00545 void free_data(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, void *address, INT size)
00546 {
00547    FREE_DESCRIP *pfree, *pprev, *pnext;
00548 
00549    if (size == 0)
00550       return;
00551 
00552    /* quadword alignment for alpha CPU */
00553    size = ALIGN8(size);
00554 
00555    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) address;
00556    pprev = NULL;
00557 
00558    /* clear current block */
00559    memset(address, 0, size);
00560 
00561    /* if data comes before first free block, adjust pheader */
00562    if ((PTYPE) address - (PTYPE) pheader < pheader->first_free_data) {
00563       pfree->size = size;
00564       pfree->next_free = pheader->first_free_data;
00565       pheader->first_free_data = (PTYPE) address - (PTYPE) pheader;
00566    } else {
00567       /* find last free block before current block */
00568       pprev = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data);
00569 
00570       while (pprev->next_free < (PTYPE) address - (PTYPE) pheader) {
00571          if (pprev->next_free <= 0) {
00572             cm_msg(MERROR, "free_data",
00573                    "database is corrupted: pprev=0x%x, pprev->next_free=%d",
00574                    pprev, pprev->next_free);
00575             return;
00576          }
00577 
00578          pprev = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pprev->next_free);
00579       }
00580 
00581       pfree->size = size;
00582       pfree->next_free = pprev->next_free;
00583 
00584       pprev->next_free = (PTYPE) pfree - (PTYPE) pheader;
00585    }
00586 
00587    /* try to melt adjacent free blocks after current block */
00588    pnext = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00589    if ((PTYPE) pnext == (PTYPE) pfree + pfree->size) {
00590       pfree->size += pnext->size;
00591       pfree->next_free = pnext->next_free;
00592 
00593       memset(pnext, 0, pnext->size);
00594    }
00595 
00596    /* try to melt adjacent free blocks before current block */
00597    if (pprev && pprev->next_free == (PTYPE) pprev - (PTYPE) pheader + pprev->size) {
00598       pprev->size += pfree->size;
00599       pprev->next_free = pfree->next_free;
00600 
00601       memset(pfree, 0, pfree->size);
00602    }
00603 }
00604 
00605 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00606 void *realloc_data(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, void *address, INT old_size, INT new_size)
00607 {
00608    void *tmp = NULL, *pnew;
00609 
00610    if (old_size) {
00611       tmp = malloc(old_size);
00612       if (tmp == NULL)
00613          return NULL;
00614 
00615       memcpy(tmp, address, old_size);
00616       free_data(pheader, address, old_size);
00617    }
00618 
00619    pnew = malloc_data(pheader, new_size);
00620 
00621    if (pnew && old_size)
00622       memcpy(pnew, tmp, old_size < new_size ? old_size : new_size);
00623 
00624    if (old_size)
00625       free(tmp);
00626 
00627    return pnew;
00628 }
00629 
00630 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00631 char *strcomb(char **list)
00632 /* convert list of strings into single string to be used by db_paste() */
00633 {
00634    INT i, j;
00635    static char *str = NULL;
00636 
00637    /* counter number of chars */
00638    for (i = 0, j = 0; list[i]; i++)
00639       j += strlen(list[i]) + 1;
00640    j += 1;
00641 
00642    if (str == NULL)
00643       str = (char *) malloc(j);
00644    else
00645       str = (char *) realloc(str, j);
00646 
00647    str[0] = 0;
00648    for (i = 0; list[i]; i++) {
00649       strcat(str, list[i]);
00650       strcat(str, "\n");
00651    }
00652 
00653    return str;
00654 }
00655 
00656 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00657 INT print_key_info(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, KEY * pkey, INT level, void *info)
00658 {
00659    int i;
00660    char *p;
00661 
00662    p = (char *) info;
00663 
00664    sprintf(p + strlen(p), "%08X  %08X  %04X    ",
00665            (int)(hKey - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)),
00666            (int)(pkey->data - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)), (int)pkey->total_size);
00667 
00668    for (i = 0; i < level; i++)
00669       sprintf(p + strlen(p), "  ");
00670 
00671    sprintf(p + strlen(p), "%s\n", pkey->name);
00672 
00673    return SUCCESS;
00674 }
00675 
00676 INT db_show_mem(HNDLE hDB, char *result, INT buf_size, BOOL verbose)
00677 {
00678    DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
00679    INT total_size_key, total_size_data;
00680    FREE_DESCRIP *pfree;
00681 
00682    db_lock_database(hDB);
00683 
00684    pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
00685 
00686    sprintf(result,
00687            "Database header size is 0x%04X, all following values are offset by this!\nKey area  0x00000000 - 0x%08X\nData area 0x%08X - 0x%08X\n\n",
00688            (int)sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER), pheader->key_size - 1,
00689            pheader->key_size, pheader->key_size + pheader->data_size);
00690 
00691    strcat(result, "Keylist:\n");
00692    strcat(result, "--------\n");
00693    total_size_key = 0;
00694    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key);
00695 
00696    while ((PTYPE) pfree != (PTYPE) pheader) {
00697       total_size_key += pfree->size;
00698       sprintf(result + strlen(result),
00699               "Free block at 0x%08X, size 0x%08X, next 0x%08X\n",
00700               (int)((PTYPE) pfree - (PTYPE) pheader - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)),
00701               pfree->size,
00702               pfree->next_free ? (int)(pfree->next_free - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) : 0);
00703       pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00704    }
00705 
00706    strcat(result, "\nData:\n");
00707    strcat(result, "-----\n");
00708    total_size_data = 0;
00709    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data);
00710 
00711    while ((PTYPE) pfree != (PTYPE) pheader) {
00712       total_size_data += pfree->size;
00713       sprintf(result + strlen(result),
00714               "Free block at 0x%08X, size 0x%08X, next 0x%08X\n",
00715               (int)((PTYPE) pfree - (PTYPE) pheader - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)),
00716               pfree->size,
00717               pfree->next_free ? (int)(pfree->next_free - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) : 0);
00718       pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00719    }
00720    sprintf(result + strlen(result),
00721            "\nTotal size: %1d (0x%08X) keylist, %1d (0x%08X) data\n",
00722            total_size_key, total_size_key, total_size_data, total_size_data);
00723    sprintf(result + strlen(result),
00724            "\nFree: %1d (%1.1lf%%) keylist, %1d (%1.1lf%%) data\n",
00725            total_size_key,
00726            100 * (double) total_size_key / pheader->key_size,
00727            total_size_data, 100 * (double) total_size_data / pheader->data_size);
00728 
00729    if (verbose) {
00730       sprintf(result + strlen(result), "\n\n");
00731       sprintf(result + strlen(result), "Key       Data      Size\n");
00732       sprintf(result + strlen(result), "------------------------\n");
00733       db_scan_tree(hDB, pheader->root_key, 0, print_key_info, result);
00734    }
00735 
00736    db_unlock_database(hDB);
00737 
00738    return DB_SUCCESS;
00739 }
00740 
00741 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00742 static int db_validate_key_offset(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, int offset)
00743 /* check if key offset lies in valid range */
00744 {
00745    if (offset != 0 && offset < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER))
00746       return 0;
00747 
00748    if (offset > (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + pheader->key_size)
00749       return 0;
00750 
00751    return 1;
00752 }
00753 
00754 static int db_validate_data_offset(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, int offset)
00755 /* check if data offset lies in valid range */
00756 {
00757    if (offset != 0 && offset < (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER))
00758       return 0;
00759 
00760    if (offset > (int) sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + pheader->key_size + pheader->data_size)
00761       return 0;
00762 
00763    return 1;
00764 }
00765 
00766 static int db_validate_hkey(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, HNDLE hKey)
00767 {
00768    return db_validate_key_offset(pheader, hKey);
00769 }
00770 
00771 static int db_validate_key(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader, int recurse,
00772                            const char *path, KEY * pkey)
00773 {
00774    KEYLIST *pkeylist;
00775    int i;
00776    static time_t t_min = 0, t_max;
00777 
00778    if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader)) {
00779       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00780              "Warning: database corruption, key \"%s\", data 0x%08X", path,
00781              pkey->data - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00782       return 0;
00783    }
00784 
00785    if (!db_validate_data_offset(pheader, pkey->data)) {
00786       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00787              "Warning: database corruption, data \"%s\", data 0x%08X",
00788              path, pkey->data - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00789       return 0;
00790    }
00791 
00792    /* check key type */
00793    if (pkey->type >= TID_LAST) {
00794       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00795              "Warning: invalid key type, key \"%s\", type %d", path, pkey->type);
00796       return 0;
00797    }
00798 
00799    /* check key sizes */
00800    if ((pkey->total_size < 0) || (pkey->total_size > pheader->key_size)) {
00801       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00802              "Warning: invalid key \"%s\" total_size: %d", path, pkey->total_size);
00803       return 0;
00804    }
00805 
00806    if ((pkey->item_size < 0) || (pkey->item_size > pheader->key_size)) {
00807       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00808              "Warning: invalid key \"%s\" item_size: %d", path, pkey->item_size);
00809       return 0;
00810    }
00811 
00812    if ((pkey->num_values < 0) || (pkey->num_values > pheader->key_size)) {
00813       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00814              "Warning: invalid key \"%s\" num_values: %d", path, pkey->num_values);
00815       return 0;
00816    }
00817 
00818    /* check and correct key size */
00819    if (pkey->total_size != pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values) {
00820       cm_msg(MINFO, "db_validate_key",
00821              "Warning: corrected key \"%s\" size: total_size=%d, should be %d*%d=%d",
00822              path, pkey->total_size, pkey->item_size, pkey->num_values,
00823              pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values);
00824       pkey->total_size = pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values;
00825    }
00826 
00827    /* check access mode */
00828    if ((pkey->
00829         access_mode & ~(MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE |
00830                         MODE_EXCLUSIVE | MODE_ALLOC))) {
00831       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00832              "Warning: invalid access mode, key \"%s\", mode %d", path,
00833              pkey->access_mode);
00834       return 0;
00835    }
00836 
00837    /* check access time, consider valid if within +- 10 years */
00838    if (t_min == 0) {
00839       t_min = ss_time() - 3600 * 24 * 365 * 10;
00840       t_max = ss_time() + 3600 * 24 * 365 * 10;
00841    }
00842 
00843    if (pkey->last_written > 0 &&
00844        (pkey->last_written < t_min || pkey->last_written > t_max)) {
00845       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00846              "Warning: invalid access time, key \"%s\", time %d", path,
00847              pkey->last_written);
00848       return 0;
00849    }
00850 
00851    if (pkey->type == TID_KEY && recurse) {
00852       /* if key has subkeys, go through whole list */
00853 
00854       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
00855 
00856       if (pkeylist->num_keys != 0 &&
00857           (pkeylist->first_key == 0
00858            || !db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkeylist->first_key))) {
00859          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00860                 "Warning: database corruption, key \"%s\", first_key 0x%08X",
00861                 path, pkeylist->first_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00862          return 0;
00863       }
00864 
00865       /* check if key is in keylist */
00866       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
00867 
00868       for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
00869          char buf[1024];
00870          sprintf(buf, "%s/%s", path, pkey->name);
00871 
00872          if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
00873             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_key",
00874                    "Warning: database corruption, key \"%s\", next_key 0x%08X",
00875                    buf, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00876             return 0;
00877          }
00878 
00879          if (pkey->type == TID_KEY)
00880             if (!db_validate_key(pheader, recurse + 1, buf, pkey))
00881                return 0;
00882 
00883          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
00884       }
00885    }
00886 
00887    return 1;
00888 }
00889 
00890 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00891 static int db_validate_db(DATABASE_HEADER * pheader)
00892 {
00893    int total_size_key = 0;
00894    int total_size_data = 0;
00895    double ratio;
00896    FREE_DESCRIP *pfree;
00897 
00898    /* validate the key free list */
00899 
00900    if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pheader->first_free_key)) {
00901       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00902              "Warning: database corruption, first_free_key 0x%08X",
00903              pheader->first_free_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00904       return 0;
00905    }
00906 
00907    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key);
00908 
00909    while ((PTYPE) pfree != (PTYPE) pheader) {
00910       if (pfree->next_free != 0 && !db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pfree->next_free)) {
00911          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00912                 "Warning: database corruption, next_free 0x%08X",
00913                 pfree->next_free - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00914          return 0;
00915       }
00916 
00917       total_size_key += pfree->size;
00918       pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00919    }
00920 
00921    ratio = ((double) (pheader->key_size - total_size_key)) / ((double) pheader->key_size);
00922    if (ratio > 0.9)
00923       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00924              "Warning: database key area is %.0f%% full", ratio * 100.0);
00925 
00926    if (total_size_key > pheader->key_size) {
00927       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00928              "Warning: database corruption, total_key_size 0x%08X", total_size_key);
00929       return 0;
00930    }
00931 
00932    /* validate the data free list */
00933 
00934    if (!db_validate_data_offset(pheader, pheader->first_free_data)) {
00935       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00936              "Warning: database corruption, first_free_data 0x%08X",
00937              pheader->first_free_data - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00938       return 0;
00939    }
00940 
00941    pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data);
00942 
00943    while ((PTYPE) pfree != (PTYPE) pheader) {
00944       if (pfree->next_free != 0 && !db_validate_data_offset(pheader, pfree->next_free)) {
00945          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00946                 "Warning: database corruption, next_free 0x%08X",
00947                 pfree->next_free - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00948          return 0;
00949       }
00950 
00951       total_size_data += pfree->size;
00952       pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pfree->next_free);
00953    }
00954 
00955    ratio =
00956        ((double) (pheader->data_size - total_size_data)) / ((double) pheader->data_size);
00957    if (ratio > 0.9)
00958       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00959              "Warning: database data area is %.0f%% full", ratio * 100.0);
00960 
00961    if (total_size_data > pheader->data_size) {
00962       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00963              "Warning: database corruption, total_size_data 0x%08X", total_size_key);
00964       return 0;
00965    }
00966 
00967    /* validate the tree of keys, starting from the root key */
00968 
00969    if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pheader->root_key)) {
00970       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_validate_db",
00971              "Warning: database corruption, root_key 0x%08X",
00972              pheader->root_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
00973       return 0;
00974    }
00975 
00976    return db_validate_key(pheader, 1, "", (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->root_key));
00977 }
00978 
00980 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
00981 
00982 /********************************************************************/
00993 INT db_open_database(char *database_name, INT database_size,
00994                      HNDLE * hDB, char *client_name)
00995 {
00996    if (rpc_is_remote())
00997       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_OPEN_DATABASE, database_name, database_size,
00998                       hDB, client_name);
00999 
01000 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01001    {
01002       INT i, status;
01003       HNDLE handle;
01004       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
01005       BOOL shm_created;
01006       HNDLE shm_handle;
01007       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01008       KEY *pkey;
01009       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
01010       FREE_DESCRIP *pfree;
01011       BOOL call_watchdog;
01012       DWORD timeout;
01013 
01014       if (database_size < 0 || database_size > 10E7) {
01015          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database", "invalid database size");
01016          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
01017       }
01018 
01019       /* restrict name length */
01020       if (strlen(database_name) >= NAME_LENGTH)
01021          database_name[NAME_LENGTH] = 0;
01022 
01023       /* allocate new space for the new database descriptor */
01024       if (_database_entries == 0) {
01025          _database = (DATABASE *) malloc(sizeof(DATABASE));
01026          memset(_database, 0, sizeof(DATABASE));
01027          if (_database == NULL) {
01028             *hDB = 0;
01029             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
01030          }
01031 
01032          _database_entries = 1;
01033          i = 0;
01034       } else {
01035          /* check if database already open */
01036          for (i = 0; i < _database_entries; i++)
01037             if (_database[i].attached && equal_ustring(_database[i].name, database_name)) {
01038                /* check if database belongs to this thread */
01039                if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_MTHREAD) {
01040                   if (_database[i].index == ss_gettid()) {
01041                      *hDB = i + 1;
01042                      return DB_SUCCESS;
01043                   }
01044                } else {
01045                   *hDB = i + 1;
01046                   return DB_SUCCESS;
01047                }
01048             }
01049 
01050          /* check for a deleted entry */
01051          for (i = 0; i < _database_entries; i++)
01052             if (!_database[i].attached)
01053                break;
01054 
01055          /* if not found, create new one */
01056          if (i == _database_entries) {
01057             _database =
01058                 (DATABASE *) realloc(_database,
01059                                      sizeof(DATABASE) * (_database_entries + 1));
01060             memset(&_database[_database_entries], 0, sizeof(DATABASE));
01061 
01062             _database_entries++;
01063             if (_database == NULL) {
01064                _database_entries--;
01065                *hDB = 0;
01066                return DB_NO_MEMORY;
01067             }
01068          }
01069       }
01070 
01071       handle = (HNDLE) i;
01072 
01073       /* open shared memory region */
01074       status = ss_shm_open(database_name,
01075                            sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) +
01076                            2 * ALIGN8(database_size / 2),
01077                            (void **) &(_database[(INT) handle].
01078                                        database_header), &shm_handle);
01079 
01080       if (status == SS_NO_MEMORY || status == SS_FILE_ERROR) {
01081          *hDB = 0;
01082          return DB_INVALID_NAME;
01083       }
01084 
01085       /* shortcut to header */
01086       pheader = _database[handle].database_header;
01087 
01088       /* save name */
01089       strcpy(_database[handle].name, database_name);
01090 
01091       shm_created = (status == SS_CREATED);
01092 
01093       /* clear memeory for debugging */
01094       /* memset(pheader, 0, sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + 2*ALIGN8(database_size/2)); */
01095 
01096       if (shm_created && pheader->name[0] == 0) {
01097          /* setup header info if database was created */
01098          memset(pheader, 0, sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + 2 * ALIGN8(database_size / 2));
01099 
01100          strcpy(pheader->name, database_name);
01101          pheader->version = DATABASE_VERSION;
01102          pheader->key_size = ALIGN8(database_size / 2);
01103          pheader->data_size = ALIGN8(database_size / 2);
01104          pheader->root_key = sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER);
01105          pheader->first_free_key = sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER);
01106          pheader->first_free_data = sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + pheader->key_size;
01107 
01108          /* set up free list */
01109          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key);
01110          pfree->size = pheader->key_size;
01111          pfree->next_free = 0;
01112 
01113          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data);
01114          pfree->size = pheader->data_size;
01115          pfree->next_free = 0;
01116 
01117          /* create root key */
01118          pkey = (KEY *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEY));
01119 
01120          /* set key properties */
01121          pkey->type = TID_KEY;
01122          pkey->num_values = 1;
01123          pkey->access_mode = MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE;
01124          strcpy(pkey->name, "root");
01125          pkey->parent_keylist = 0;
01126 
01127          /* create keylist */
01128          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEYLIST));
01129 
01130          /* store keylist in data field */
01131          pkey->data = (PTYPE) pkeylist - (PTYPE) pheader;
01132          pkey->item_size = sizeof(KEYLIST);
01133          pkey->total_size = sizeof(KEYLIST);
01134 
01135          pkeylist->parent = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
01136          pkeylist->num_keys = 0;
01137          pkeylist->first_key = 0;
01138       }
01139 
01140       /* check database version */
01141       if (pheader->version != DATABASE_VERSION) {
01142          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database", "Different database format: Shared memory is %d, program is %d",
01143             pheader->version, DATABASE_VERSION);
01144          return DB_VERSION_MISMATCH;
01145       }
01146 
01147       /* create mutex for the database */
01148       status = ss_mutex_create(database_name, &(_database[handle].mutex));
01149       if (status != SS_SUCCESS && status != SS_CREATED) {
01150          *hDB = 0;
01151          return DB_NO_MUTEX;
01152       }
01153       _database[handle].lock_cnt = 0;
01154 
01155       /* first lock database */
01156       status = db_lock_database(handle + 1);
01157       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
01158          return status;
01159 
01160       /*
01161          Now we have a DATABASE_HEADER, so let's setup a CLIENT
01162          structure in that database. The information there can also
01163          be seen by other processes.
01164        */
01165 
01166       /*
01167          update the client count
01168        */
01169       pheader->num_clients = 0;
01170       pheader->max_client_index = 0;
01171       for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++) {
01172          if (pheader->client[i].pid == 0)
01173             continue;
01174          pheader->num_clients++;
01175          pheader->max_client_index = i + 1;
01176       }
01177 
01178       /*fprintf(stderr,"num_clients: %d, max_client: %d\n",pheader->num_clients,pheader->max_client_index); */
01179 
01180       /*
01181          Look for empty client slot
01182        */
01183       for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++)
01184          if (pheader->client[i].pid == 0)
01185             break;
01186 
01187       if (i == MAX_CLIENTS) {
01188          db_unlock_database(handle + 1);
01189          *hDB = 0;
01190          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database", "maximum number of clients exceeded");
01191          return DB_NO_SLOT;
01192       }
01193 
01194       /* store slot index in _database structure */
01195       _database[handle].client_index = i;
01196 
01197       /*
01198          Save the index of the last client of that database so that later only
01199          the clients 0..max_client_index-1 have to be searched through.
01200        */
01201       pheader->num_clients++;
01202       if (i + 1 > pheader->max_client_index)
01203          pheader->max_client_index = i + 1;
01204 
01205       /* setup database header and client structure */
01206       pclient = &pheader->client[i];
01207 
01208       memset(pclient, 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
01209       /* use client name previously set by bm_set_name */
01210       strcpy(pclient->name, client_name);
01211       pclient->pid = ss_getpid();
01212       pclient->tid = ss_gettid();
01213       pclient->thandle = ss_getthandle();
01214       pclient->num_open_records = 0;
01215 
01216       ss_suspend_get_port(&pclient->port);
01217 
01218       pclient->last_activity = ss_millitime();
01219 
01220       cm_get_watchdog_params(&call_watchdog, &timeout);
01221       pclient->watchdog_timeout = timeout;
01222 
01223       /* check ODB for corruption */
01224       if (!db_validate_db(pheader)) {
01225          /* do not treat corrupted odb as a fatal error- allow the user
01226             to preceed at own risk- the database is already corrupted,
01227             so no further harm can possibly be made. */
01228          /*
01229             db_unlock_database(handle + 1);
01230             *hDB = 0;
01231             return DB_CORRUPTED;
01232           */
01233       }
01234 
01235       /* setup _database entry */
01236       _database[handle].database_data = _database[handle].database_header + 1;
01237       _database[handle].attached = TRUE;
01238       _database[handle].shm_handle = shm_handle;
01239       _database[handle].protect = FALSE;
01240 
01241       /* remember to which connection acutal buffer belongs */
01242       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE)
01243          _database[handle].index = rpc_get_server_acception();
01244       else
01245          _database[handle].index = ss_gettid();
01246 
01247       *hDB = (handle + 1);
01248 
01249       /* setup dispatcher for updated records */
01250       ss_suspend_set_dispatch(CH_IPC, 0, (int (*)(void)) cm_dispatch_ipc);
01251 
01252 
01253       /* remove dead clients */
01254 
01255 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01256 #ifdef ESRCH
01257       /* Only enable this for systems that define ESRCH and hope that
01258          they also support kill(pid,0) */
01259       for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++) {
01260          int k;
01261 
01262          errno = 0;
01263          kill(pheader->client[i].pid, 0);
01264          if (errno == ESRCH) {
01265             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database",
01266                    "removing client %s, pid %d, index %d because the pid no longer exists",
01267                    pheader->client[i].name, pheader->client[i].pid, i);
01268 
01269             /* decrement notify_count for open records and clear exclusive mode */
01270             for (k = 0; k < pheader->client[i].max_index; k++)
01271                if (pheader->client[i].open_record[k].handle) {
01272                   pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader +
01273                                   pheader->client[i].open_record[k].handle);
01274                   if (pkey->notify_count > 0)
01275                      pkey->notify_count--;
01276 
01277                   if (pheader->client[i].open_record[k].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
01278                      db_set_mode(handle + 1, pheader->client[i].open_record[k].handle,
01279                                  (WORD) (pkey->access_mode & ~MODE_EXCLUSIVE), 2);
01280                }
01281 
01282             /* clear entry from client structure in database header */
01283             memset(&(pheader->client[i]), 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
01284          }
01285       }
01286 #endif
01287 #endif
01288 
01289       db_unlock_database(handle + 1);
01290 
01291       if (shm_created)
01292          return DB_CREATED;
01293    }
01294 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01295 
01296    return DB_SUCCESS;
01297 }
01298 
01299 /********************************************************************/
01305 INT db_close_database(HNDLE hDB)
01306 {
01307    if (rpc_is_remote())
01308       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_CLOSE_DATABASE, hDB);
01309 
01310 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01311    else {
01312       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01313       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
01314       INT index, destroy_flag, i, j;
01315 
01316       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01317          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_close_database", "invalid database handle");
01318          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01319       }
01320 
01321       /*
01322          Check if database was opened by current thread. This is necessary
01323          in the server process where one thread may not close the database
01324          of other threads.
01325        */
01326 
01327       /* first lock database */
01328       db_lock_database(hDB);
01329 
01330       index = _database[hDB - 1].client_index;
01331       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
01332       pclient = &pheader->client[index];
01333 
01334       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE &&
01335           _database[hDB - 1].index != rpc_get_server_acception()) {
01336          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01337          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01338       }
01339 
01340       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE &&
01341           _database[hDB - 1].index != ss_gettid()) {
01342          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01343          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01344       }
01345 
01346       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
01347          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_close_database", "invalid database handle");
01348          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01349          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01350       }
01351 
01352       /* close all open records */
01353       for (i = 0; i < pclient->max_index; i++)
01354          if (pclient->open_record[i].handle)
01355             db_remove_open_record(hDB, pclient->open_record[i].handle, FALSE);
01356 
01357       /* mark entry in _database as empty */
01358       _database[hDB - 1].attached = FALSE;
01359 
01360       /* clear entry from client structure in database header */
01361       memset(&(pheader->client[index]), 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
01362 
01363       /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
01364       for (i = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; i >= 0; i--)
01365          if (pheader->client[i].pid != 0)
01366             break;
01367       pheader->max_client_index = i + 1;
01368 
01369       /* count new number of clients */
01370       for (i = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, j = 0; i >= 0; i--)
01371          if (pheader->client[i].pid != 0)
01372             j++;
01373       pheader->num_clients = j;
01374 
01375       destroy_flag = (pheader->num_clients == 0);
01376 
01377       /* flush shared memory to disk */
01378       ss_shm_flush(pheader->name, pheader,
01379                    sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + 2 * pheader->data_size);
01380 
01381       /* unmap shared memory, delete it if we are the last */
01382       ss_shm_close(pheader->name, pheader, _database[hDB - 1].shm_handle, destroy_flag);
01383 
01384       /* unlock database */
01385       db_unlock_database(hDB);
01386 
01387       /* delete mutex */
01388       ss_mutex_delete(_database[hDB - 1].mutex, destroy_flag);
01389 
01390       /* update _database_entries */
01391       if (hDB == _database_entries)
01392          _database_entries--;
01393 
01394       if (_database_entries > 0)
01395          _database =
01396              (DATABASE *) realloc(_database, sizeof(DATABASE) * (_database_entries));
01397       else {
01398          free(_database);
01399          _database = NULL;
01400       }
01401 
01402       /* if we are the last one, also delete other mutexes */
01403       if (destroy_flag) {
01404          extern INT _mutex_elog, _mutex_alarm;
01405 
01406          if (_mutex_elog)
01407             ss_mutex_delete(_mutex_elog, TRUE);
01408          if (_mutex_alarm)
01409             ss_mutex_delete(_mutex_alarm, TRUE);
01410       }
01411 
01412    }
01413 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01414 
01415    return DB_SUCCESS;
01416 }
01417 
01419 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
01420 
01421 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01422 INT db_flush_database(HNDLE hDB)
01423 /********************************************************************\
01424 
01425   Routine: db_flush_database
01426 
01427   Purpose: Flushes the shared memory of a database to its disk file.
01428 
01429   Input:
01430     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database, which is used as
01431                             an index to the _database array.
01432 
01433   Output:
01434     none
01435 
01436   Function value:
01437     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
01438     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
01439     RPC_NET_ERROR           Network error
01440 
01441 \********************************************************************/
01442 {
01443    if (rpc_is_remote())
01444       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_FLUSH_DATABASE, hDB);
01445 
01446 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01447    else {
01448       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01449       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
01450       INT index;
01451 
01452       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01453          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_close_database", "invalid database handle");
01454          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01455       }
01456 
01457       /*
01458          Check if database was opened by current thread. This is necessary
01459          in the server process where one thread may not close the database
01460          of other threads.
01461        */
01462 
01463       db_lock_database(hDB);
01464       index = _database[hDB - 1].client_index;
01465       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
01466       pclient = &pheader->client[index];
01467 
01468       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE &&
01469           _database[hDB - 1].index != rpc_get_server_acception()) {
01470          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01471          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01472       }
01473 
01474       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE &&
01475           _database[hDB - 1].index != ss_gettid()) {
01476          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01477          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01478       }
01479 
01480       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
01481          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_close_database", "invalid database handle");
01482          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01483          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01484       }
01485 
01486       /* flush shared memory to disk */
01487       ss_shm_flush(pheader->name, pheader,
01488                    sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + 2 * pheader->data_size);
01489       db_unlock_database(hDB);
01490 
01491    }
01492 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01493 
01494    return DB_SUCCESS;
01495 }
01496 
01497 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01498 INT db_close_all_databases(void)
01499 /********************************************************************\
01500 
01501   Routine: db_close_all_databases
01502 
01503   Purpose: Close all open databases and open records
01504 
01505   Input:
01506     none
01507 
01508   Output:
01509     none
01510 
01511   Function value:
01512     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
01513 
01514 \********************************************************************/
01515 {
01516    INT status;
01517 
01518    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
01519       status = rpc_call(RPC_DB_CLOSE_ALL_DATABASES);
01520       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
01521          return status;
01522    }
01523 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01524    {
01525       INT i;
01526 
01527       for (i = _database_entries; i > 0; i--)
01528          db_close_database(i);
01529    }
01530 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01531 
01532    return db_close_all_records();
01533 }
