01536 INT db_set_client_name(HNDLE hDB, char *client_name)
01537 /********************************************************************\
01538 
01539   Routine: db_set_client_name
01540 
01541   Purpose: Set client name for a database. Used by cm_connect_experiment
01542            if a client name is duplicate and changed.
01543 
01544   Input:
01545     INT  hDB                Handle to database
01546     char *client_name       Name of this application
01547 
01548   Output:
01549 
01550   Function value:
01551     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
01552     RPC_NET_ERROR           Network error
01553 
01554 \********************************************************************/
01555 {
01556    if (rpc_is_remote())
01557       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_CLIENT_NAME, hDB, client_name);
01558 
01559 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01560    {
01561       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01562       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
01563       INT index;
01564 
01565       index = _database[hDB - 1].client_index;
01566       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
01567       pclient = &pheader->client[index];
01568 
01569       strcpy(pclient->name, client_name);
01570    }
01571 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01572 
01573    return DB_SUCCESS;
01574 }
01575 
01577 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
01578 
01579 /********************************************************************/
01585 INT db_lock_database(HNDLE hDB)
01586 {
01587 
01588 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01589    int status;
01590 
01591    if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01592       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_lock_database", "invalid database handle, aborting...");
01593       abort();
01594       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01595    }
01596 
01597    if (_database[hDB - 1].protect && _database[hDB - 1].database_header != NULL) {
01598       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_lock_database", "internal error: DB already locked, aborting...");
01599       abort();
01600       return DB_NO_MUTEX;
01601    }
01602    
01603    if (_database[hDB - 1].lock_cnt == 0) {
01604       /* wait max. 5 minutes for mutex (required if locking process is being debugged) */
01605       status = ss_mutex_wait_for(_database[hDB - 1].mutex, 5*60*1000);
01606       if (status == SS_TIMEOUT) {
01607          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_lock_database", "timeout obtaining lock for database, exiting...");
01608          exit(1);
01609          return DB_TIMEOUT;
01610       }
01611       if (status != SS_SUCCESS) {
01612          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_lock_database", "cannot lock database, ss_mutex_wait_for() status %d, aborting...",status);
01613          abort();
01614          return DB_NO_MUTEX;
01615       }
01616    }
01617 
01618    _database[hDB - 1].lock_cnt++;
01619 
01620    if (_database[hDB - 1].protect) {
01621       if (_database[hDB - 1].database_header == NULL)
01622          ss_shm_unprotect(_database[hDB - 1].shm_handle,
01623                           (void **) &_database[hDB - 1].database_header);
01624    }
01625 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01626    return DB_SUCCESS;
01627 }
01628 
01629 /********************************************************************/
01635 INT db_unlock_database(HNDLE hDB)
01636 {
01637 
01638 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01639    if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01640       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_unlock_database", "invalid database handle");
01641       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01642    }
01643 
01644    if (_database[hDB - 1].lock_cnt == 1)
01645       ss_mutex_release(_database[hDB - 1].mutex);
01646 
01647    if (_database[hDB - 1].lock_cnt > 0)
01648       _database[hDB - 1].lock_cnt--;
01649 
01650    if (_database[hDB - 1].protect) {
01651       ss_shm_protect(_database[hDB - 1].shm_handle, _database[hDB - 1].database_header);
01652       _database[hDB - 1].database_header = NULL;
01653    }
01654 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01655    return DB_SUCCESS;
01656 }
01657 
01658 /********************************************************************/
01664 INT db_protect_database(HNDLE hDB)
01665 {
01666 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01667    if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01668       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_unlock_database", "invalid database handle");
01669       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01670    }
01671 
01672    _database[hDB - 1].protect = TRUE;
01673    ss_shm_protect(_database[hDB - 1].shm_handle, _database[hDB - 1].database_header);
01674    _database[hDB - 1].database_header = NULL;
01675 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01676    return DB_SUCCESS;
01677 }
01678 
01679 /*---- helper routines ---------------------------------------------*/
01680 
01681 char *extract_key(char *key_list, char *key_name)
01682 {
01683    if (*key_list == '/')
01684       key_list++;
01685 
01686    while (*key_list && *key_list != '/')
01687       *key_name++ = *key_list++;
01688    *key_name = 0;
01689 
01690    return key_list;
01691 }
01692 
01693 BOOL equal_ustring(char *str1, char *str2)
01694 {
01695    if (str1 == NULL && str2 != NULL)
01696       return FALSE;
01697    if (str1 != NULL && str2 == NULL)
01698       return FALSE;
01699    if (str1 == NULL && str2 == NULL)
01700       return TRUE;
01701 
01702    while (*str1)
01703       if (toupper(*str1++) != toupper(*str2++))
01704          return FALSE;
01705 
01706    if (*str2)
01707       return FALSE;
01708 
01709    return TRUE;
01710 }
01711 
01712 /********************************************************************/
01721 INT db_create_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *key_name, DWORD type)
01722 {
01723    if (rpc_is_remote())
01724       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_CREATE_KEY, hDB, hKey, key_name, type);
01725 
01726 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01727    {
01728       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01729       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
01730       KEY *pkey, *pprev_key, *pkeyparent;
01731       char *pkey_name, str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
01732       INT i;
01733 
01734       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01735          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "invalid database handle");
01736          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01737       }
01738 
01739       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
01740          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "invalid database handle");
01741          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01742       }
01743 
01744       /* check type */
01745       if (type >= TID_LAST) {
01746          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "invalid key type %d", type);
01747          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
01748       }
01749 
01750       /* lock database */
01751       db_lock_database(hDB);
01752 
01753       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
01754       if (!hKey)
01755          hKey = pheader->root_key;
01756       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
01757 
01758       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
01759       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
01760          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01761          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01762       }
01763 
01764       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
01765          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01766          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "key has no subkeys");
01767          return DB_NO_KEY;
01768       }
01769       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
01770 
01771       pkey_name = key_name;
01772       do {
01773          /* extract single key from key_name */
01774          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str);
01775          
01776          /* do not allow empty names, like '/dir/dir//dir/' */
01777          if (str[0] == 0) {
01778             db_unlock_database(hDB);
01779             return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
01780          }
01781 
01782          /* check if parent or current directory */
01783          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
01784             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
01785                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
01786                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
01787             }
01788             continue;
01789          }
01790          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
01791             continue;
01792 
01793          /* check if key is in keylist */
01794          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
01795          pprev_key = NULL;
01796 
01797          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
01798             if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
01799                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key",
01800                       "Warning: database corruption, key %s, next_key 0x%08X",
01801                       key_name, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
01802                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01803                return DB_CORRUPTED;
01804             }
01805 
01806             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
01807                break;
01808 
01809             pprev_key = pkey;
01810             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
01811          }
01812 
01813          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
01814             /* not found: create new key */
01815 
01816             /* check parent for write access */
01817             pkeyparent = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
01818             if (!(pkeyparent->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) ||
01819                 (pkeyparent->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
01820                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01821                return DB_NO_ACCESS;
01822             }
01823 
01824             pkeylist->num_keys++;
01825 
01826             if (*pkey_name == '/' || type == TID_KEY) {
01827                /* create new key with keylist */
01828                pkey = (KEY *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEY));
01829 
01830                if (pkey == NULL) {
01831                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
01832                   cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "online database full");
01833                   return DB_FULL;
01834                }
01835 
01836                /* append key to key list */
01837                if (pprev_key)
01838                   pprev_key->next_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
01839                else
01840                   pkeylist->first_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
01841 
01842                /* set key properties */
01843                pkey->type = TID_KEY;
01844                pkey->num_values = 1;
01845                pkey->access_mode = MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE;
01846                strcpy(pkey->name, str);
01847                pkey->parent_keylist = (PTYPE) pkeylist - (PTYPE) pheader;
01848 
01849                /* find space for new keylist */
01850                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEYLIST));
01851 
01852                if (pkeylist == NULL) {
01853                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
01854                   cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "online database full");
01855                   return DB_FULL;
01856                }
01857 
01858                /* store keylist in data field */
01859                pkey->data = (PTYPE) pkeylist - (PTYPE) pheader;
01860                pkey->item_size = sizeof(KEYLIST);
01861                pkey->total_size = sizeof(KEYLIST);
01862 
01863                pkeylist->parent = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
01864                pkeylist->num_keys = 0;
01865                pkeylist->first_key = 0;
01866             } else {
01867                /* create new key with data */
01868                pkey = (KEY *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEY));
01869 
01870                if (pkey == NULL) {
01871                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
01872                   cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "online database full");
01873                   return DB_FULL;
01874                }
01875 
01876                /* append key to key list */
01877                if (pprev_key)
01878                   pprev_key->next_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
01879                else
01880                   pkeylist->first_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
01881 
01882                pkey->type = type;
01883                pkey->num_values = 1;
01884                pkey->access_mode = MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE;
01885                strcpy(pkey->name, str);
01886                pkey->parent_keylist = (PTYPE) pkeylist - (PTYPE) pheader;
01887 
01888                /* zero data */
01889                if (type != TID_STRING && type != TID_LINK) {
01890                   pkey->item_size = rpc_tid_size(type);
01891                   pkey->data = (PTYPE) malloc_data(pheader, pkey->item_size);
01892                   pkey->total_size = pkey->item_size;
01893 
01894                   if (pkey->data == 0) {
01895                      db_unlock_database(hDB);
01896                      cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "online database full");
01897                      return DB_FULL;
01898                   }
01899 
01900                   pkey->data -= (PTYPE) pheader;
01901                } else {
01902                   /* first data is empty */
01903                   pkey->item_size = 0;
01904                   pkey->total_size = 0;
01905                   pkey->data = 0;
01906                }
01907             }
01908          } else {
01909             /* key found: descend */
01910 
01911             /* resolve links */
01912             if (pkey->type == TID_LINK && pkey_name[0]) {
01913                /* copy destination, strip '/' */
01914                strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
01915                if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
01916                   str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
01917 
01918                /* append rest of key name */
01919                strcat(str, pkey_name);
01920 
01921                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01922 
01923                return db_create_key(hDB, 0, str, type);
01924             }
01925 
01926             if (!(*pkey_name == '/')) {
01927                if ((WORD) pkey->type != type)
01928                   cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "redefinition of key type mismatch");
01929 
01930                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01931                return DB_KEY_EXIST;
01932             }
01933 
01934             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
01935                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01936                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "key used with value and as parent key");
01937                return DB_KEY_EXIST;
01938             }
01939 
01940             pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
01941          }
01942       } while (*pkey_name == '/');
01943 
01944       db_unlock_database(hDB);
01945    }
01946 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01947 
01948    return DB_SUCCESS;
01949 }
01950 
01951 /********************************************************************/
01960 INT db_create_link(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *link_name, char *destination)
01961 {
01962    HNDLE hkey;
01963    int status;
01964 
01965    if (rpc_is_remote())
01966       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_CREATE_LINK, hDB, hKey, link_name, destination);
01967 
01968    /* check if destination exists */
01969    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, destination, &hkey);
01970    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
01971       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_link",
01972              "Link destination \"%s\" does not exist", destination);
01973       return DB_NO_KEY;
01974    }
01975 
01976    return db_set_value(hDB, hKey, link_name, destination,
01977                        strlen(destination) + 1, 1, TID_LINK);
01978 }
01979 
01980 /********************************************************************/
01990 INT db_delete_key1(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT level, BOOL follow_links)
01991 {
01992 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01993    {
01994       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01995       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
01996       KEY *pkey, *pnext_key, *pkey_tmp;
01997       HNDLE hKeyLink;
01998       BOOL deny_delete;
01999       INT status;
02000 
02001       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02002          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_delete_key1", "invalid database handle");
02003          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02004       }
02005 
02006       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02007          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_delete_key1", "invalid database handle");
02008          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02009       }
02010 
02011       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
02012          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_delete_key1", "invalid key handle");
02013          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02014       }
02015 
02016       /* lock database at the top level */
02017       if (level == 0)
02018          db_lock_database(hDB);
02019 
02020       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02021 
02022       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02023 
02024       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02025       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02026          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02027          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02028       }
02029 
02030       /* check if someone has opened key or parent */
02031       if (level == 0)
02032          do {
02033             if (pkey->notify_count) {
02034                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02035                return DB_OPEN_RECORD;
02036             }
02037 
02038             if (pkey->parent_keylist == 0)
02039                break;
02040 
02041             pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02042             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02043          } while (TRUE);
02044 
02045       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02046       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02047 
02048       deny_delete = FALSE;
02049 
02050       /* first recures subtree for keys */
02051       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY && pkeylist->first_key) {
02052          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
02053 
02054          do {
02055             pnext_key = (KEY *) (PTYPE) pkey->next_key;
02056 
02057             status = db_delete_key1(hDB, (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader,
02058                                     level + 1, follow_links);
02059 
02060             if (status == DB_NO_ACCESS)
02061                deny_delete = TRUE;
02062 
02063             if (pnext_key)
02064                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + (PTYPE) pnext_key);
02065          } while (pnext_key);
02066       }
02067 
02068       /* follow links if requested */
02069       if (pkey->type == TID_LINK && follow_links) {
02070          status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, &hKeyLink);
02071          if (status == DB_SUCCESS && follow_links < 100)
02072             db_delete_key1(hDB, hKeyLink, level + 1, follow_links + 1);
02073 
02074          if (follow_links == 100)
02075             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_delete_key1", "try to delete cyclic link");
02076       }
02077 
02078       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02079 
02080       /* return if key was already deleted by cyclic link */
02081       if (pkey->parent_keylist == 0) {
02082          if (level == 0)
02083             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02084          return DB_SUCCESS;
02085       }
02086 
02087       /* now delete key */
02088       if (hKey != pheader->root_key) {
02089          if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_DELETE) || deny_delete) {
02090             if (level == 0)
02091                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02092             return DB_NO_ACCESS;
02093          }
02094 
02095          if (pkey->notify_count) {
02096             if (level == 0)
02097                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02098             return DB_OPEN_RECORD;
02099          }
02100 
02101          /* delete key data */
02102          if (pkey->type == TID_KEY)
02103             free_key(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->total_size);
02104          else
02105             free_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->total_size);
02106 
02107          /* unlink key from list */
02108          pnext_key = (KEY *) (PTYPE) pkey->next_key;
02109          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02110 
02111          if ((KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key) == pkey) {
02112             /* key is first in list */
02113             pkeylist->first_key = (PTYPE) pnext_key;
02114          } else {
02115             /* find predecessor */
02116             pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
02117             while ((KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key) != pkey)
02118                pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key);
02119             pkey_tmp->next_key = (PTYPE) pnext_key;
02120          }
02121 
02122          /* delete key */
02123          free_key(pheader, pkey, sizeof(KEY));
02124          pkeylist->num_keys--;
02125       }
02126 
02127       if (level == 0)
02128          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02129    }
02130 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02131 
02132    return DB_SUCCESS;
02133 }
02134 
02135 /********************************************************************/
02160 INT db_delete_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, BOOL follow_links)
02161 {
02162    if (rpc_is_remote())
02163       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_DELETE_KEY, hDB, hKey, follow_links);
02164 
02165    return db_delete_key1(hDB, hKey, 0, follow_links);
02166 }
02167 
02168 /********************************************************************/
02193 INT db_find_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *key_name, HNDLE * subhKey)
02194 {
02195    if (rpc_is_remote())
02196       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_FIND_KEY, hDB, hKey, key_name, subhKey);
02197 
02198 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02199    {
02200       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02201       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02202       KEY *pkey;
02203       char *pkey_name, str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
02204       INT i, status;
02205 
02206       *subhKey = 0;
02207 
02208       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02209          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "invalid database handle");
02210          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02211       }
02212 
02213       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02214          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "invalid database handle");
02215          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02216       }
02217 
02218       db_lock_database(hDB);
02219 
02220       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02221 
02222       if (!hKey)
02223          hKey = pheader->root_key;
02224 
02225       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02226 
02227       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02228       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02229          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02230          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02231       }
02232 
02233       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02234          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "key has no subkeys");
02235          *subhKey = 0;
02236          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02237          return DB_NO_KEY;
02238       }
02239       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02240 
02241       if (key_name[0] == 0 || strcmp(key_name, "/") == 0) {
02242          if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
02243             *subhKey = 0;
02244             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02245             return DB_NO_ACCESS;
02246          }
02247 
02248          *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02249 
02250          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02251          return DB_SUCCESS;
02252       }
02253 
02254       pkey_name = key_name;
02255       do {
02256          /* extract single subkey from key_name */
02257          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str);
02258 
02259          /* check if parent or current directory */
02260          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
02261             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
02262                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02263                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02264             }
02265             continue;
02266          }
02267          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
02268             continue;
02269 
02270          /* check if key is in keylist */
02271          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
02272 
02273          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
02274             if (pkey->name[0] == 0 || !db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
02275                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key",
02276                       "Warning: database corruption, key %s, next_key 0x%08X",
02277                       key_name, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
02278                *subhKey = 0;
02279                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02280                return DB_CORRUPTED;
02281             }
02282 
02283             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
02284                break;
02285 
02286             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
02287          }
02288 
02289          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
02290             *subhKey = 0;
02291             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02292             return DB_NO_KEY;
02293          }
02294 
02295          /* resolve links */
02296          if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
02297             /* copy destination, strip '/' */
02298             strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02299             if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
02300                str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
02301 
02302             /* append rest of key name if existing */
02303             if (pkey_name[0]) {
02304                strcat(str, pkey_name);
02305                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02306                return db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02307             } else {
02308                /* if last key in chain is a link, return its destination */
02309                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02310                status = db_find_link(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02311                if (status == DB_NO_KEY)
02312                   return DB_INVALID_LINK;
02313                return status;
02314             }
02315          }
02316 
02317          /* key found: check if last in chain */
02318          if (*pkey_name == '/') {
02319             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02320                *subhKey = 0;
02321                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02322                return DB_NO_KEY;
02323             }
02324          }
02325 
02326          /* descend one level */
02327          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02328 
02329       } while (*pkey_name == '/' && *(pkey_name + 1));
02330 
02331       *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02332 
02333       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02334    }
02335 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02336 
02337    return DB_SUCCESS;
02338 }
02339 
02341 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
02342 
02343 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02344 INT db_find_key1(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *key_name, HNDLE * subhKey)
02345 /********************************************************************\
02346 
02347   Routine: db_find_key1
02348 
02349   Purpose: Same as db_find_key, but without DB locking
02350 
02351   Input:
02352     HNDLE  bufer_handle     Handle to the database
02353     HNDLE  hKey             Key handle to start the search
02354     char   *key_name        Name of key in the form "/key/key/key"
02355 
02356   Output:
02357     INT    *handle          Key handle
02358 
02359   Function value:
02360     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02361     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
02362     DB_NO_KEY               Key doesn't exist
02363     DB_NO_ACCESS            No access to read key
02364 
02365 \********************************************************************/
02366 {
02367    if (rpc_is_remote())
02368       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_FIND_KEY, hDB, hKey, key_name, subhKey);
02369 
02370 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02371    {
02372       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02373       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02374       KEY *pkey;
02375       char *pkey_name, str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
02376       INT i;
02377 
02378       *subhKey = 0;
02379 
02380       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02381          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "invalid database handle");
02382          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02383       }
02384 
02385       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02386          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "invalid database handle");
02387          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02388       }
02389 
02390       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02391       if (!hKey)
02392          hKey = pheader->root_key;
02393       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02394 
02395       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02396       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02397          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02398          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02399       }
02400 
02401       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02402          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "key has no subkeys");
02403          *subhKey = 0;
02404          return DB_NO_KEY;
02405       }
02406       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02407 
02408       if (key_name[0] == 0 || strcmp(key_name, "/") == 0) {
02409          if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
02410             *subhKey = 0;
02411             return DB_NO_ACCESS;
02412          }
02413 
02414          *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02415 
02416          return DB_SUCCESS;
02417       }
02418 
02419       pkey_name = key_name;
02420       do {
02421          /* extract single subkey from key_name */
02422          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str);
02423 
02424          /* check if parent or current directory */
02425          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
02426             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
02427                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02428                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02429             }
02430             continue;
02431          }
02432          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
02433             continue;
02434 
02435          /* check if key is in keylist */
02436          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
02437 
02438          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
02439             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
02440                break;
02441 
02442             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
02443          }
02444 
02445          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
02446             *subhKey = 0;
02447             return DB_NO_KEY;
02448          }
02449 
02450          /* resolve links */
02451          if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
02452             /* copy destination, strip '/' */
02453             strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02454             if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
02455                str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
02456 
02457             /* append rest of key name if existing */
02458             if (pkey_name[0]) {
02459                strcat(str, pkey_name);
02460                return db_find_key1(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02461             } else {
02462                /* if last key in chain is a link, return its destination */
02463                return db_find_link1(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02464             }
02465          }
02466 
02467          /* key found: check if last in chain */
02468          if (*pkey_name == '/') {
02469             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02470                *subhKey = 0;
02471                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02472                return DB_NO_KEY;
02473             }
02474          }
02475 
02476          /* descend one level */
02477          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02478 
02479       } while (*pkey_name == '/' && *(pkey_name + 1));
02480 
02481       *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02482    }
02483 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02484 
02485    return DB_SUCCESS;
02486 }
02487 
02488 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02489 INT db_find_link(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *key_name, HNDLE * subhKey)
02490 /********************************************************************\
02491 
02492   Routine: db_find_link
02493 
02494   Purpose: Find a key or link by name and return its handle
02495            (internal address). The only difference of this routine
02496            compared with db_find_key is that if the LAST key in
02497            the chain is a link, it is NOT evaluated. Links not being
02498            the last in the chain are evaluated.
02499 
02500   Input:
02501     HNDLE  bufer_handle     Handle to the database
02502     HNDLE  hKey       Key handle to start the search
02503     char   *key_name        Name of key in the form "/key/key/key"
02504 
02505   Output:
02506     INT    *handle          Key handle
02507 
02508   Function value:
02509     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02510     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
02511     DB_NO_KEY               Key doesn't exist
02512     DB_NO_ACCESS            No access to read key
02513 
02514 \********************************************************************/
02515 {
02516    if (rpc_is_remote())
02517       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_FIND_LINK, hDB, hKey, key_name, subhKey);
02518 
02519 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02520    {
02521       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02522       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02523       KEY *pkey;
02524       char *pkey_name, str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
02525       INT i;
02526 
02527       *subhKey = 0;
02528 
02529       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02530          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "Invalid database handle");
02531          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02532       }
02533 
02534       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02535          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "invalid database handle");
02536          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02537       }
02538 
02539       db_lock_database(hDB);
02540 
02541       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02542       if (!hKey)
02543          hKey = pheader->root_key;
02544       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02545 
02546       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02547       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02548          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02549          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02550       }
02551 
02552       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02553          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "key has no subkeys");
02554          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02555          return DB_NO_KEY;
02556       }
02557       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02558 
02559       if (key_name[0] == 0 || strcmp(key_name, "/") == 0) {
02560          if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
02561             *subhKey = 0;
02562             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02563             return DB_NO_ACCESS;
02564          }
02565 
02566          *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02567 
02568          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02569          return DB_SUCCESS;
02570       }
02571 
02572       pkey_name = key_name;
02573       do {
02574          /* extract single subkey from key_name */
02575          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str);
02576 
02577          /* check if parent or current directory */
02578          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
02579             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
02580                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02581                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02582             }
02583             continue;
02584          }
02585          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
02586             continue;
02587 
02588          /* check if key is in keylist */
02589          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
02590 
02591          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
02592             if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
02593                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link",
02594                       "Warning: database corruption, key \"%s\", next_key 0x%08X",
02595                       key_name, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
02596                *subhKey = 0;
02597                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02598                return DB_CORRUPTED;
02599             }
02600 
02601             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
02602                break;
02603 
02604             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
02605          }
02606 
02607          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
02608             *subhKey = 0;
02609             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02610             return DB_NO_KEY;
02611          }
02612 
02613          /* resolve links if not last in chain */
02614          if (pkey->type == TID_LINK && *pkey_name == '/') {
02615             /* copy destination, strip '/' */
02616             strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02617             if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
02618                str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
02619 
02620             /* append rest of key name */
02621             strcat(str, pkey_name);
02622             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02623             return db_find_link(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02624          }
02625 
02626          /* key found: check if last in chain */
02627          if ((*pkey_name == '/')) {
02628             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02629                *subhKey = 0;
02630                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02631                return DB_NO_KEY;
02632             }
02633          }
02634 
02635          /* descend one level */
02636          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02637 
02638       } while (*pkey_name == '/' && *(pkey_name + 1));
02639 
02640       *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02641 
02642       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02643    }
02644 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02645 
02646    return DB_SUCCESS;
02647 }
02648 
02649 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02650 INT db_find_link1(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *key_name, HNDLE * subhKey)
02651 /********************************************************************\
02652 
02653   Routine: db_find_link1
02654 
02655   Purpose: Same ad db_find_link, but without DB locking
02656 
02657   Input:
02658     HNDLE  bufer_handle     Handle to the database
02659     HNDLE  hKey       Key handle to start the search
02660     char   *key_name        Name of key in the form "/key/key/key"
02661 
02662   Output:
02663     INT    *handle          Key handle
02664 
02665   Function value:
02666     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02667     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
02668     DB_NO_KEY               Key doesn't exist
02669     DB_NO_ACCESS            No access to read key
02670 
02671 \********************************************************************/
02672 {
02673    if (rpc_is_remote())
02674       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_FIND_LINK, hDB, hKey, key_name, subhKey);
02675 
02676 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02677    {
02678       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02679       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02680       KEY *pkey;
02681       char *pkey_name, str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
02682       INT i;
02683 
02684       *subhKey = 0;
02685 
02686       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02687          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "Invalid database handle");
02688          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02689       }
02690 
02691       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02692          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "invalid database handle");
02693          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02694       }
02695 
02696       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02697       if (!hKey)
02698          hKey = pheader->root_key;
02699       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02700 
02701       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02702       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02703          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02704          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02705       }
02706 
02707       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02708          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "key has no subkeys");
02709          return DB_NO_KEY;
02710       }
02711       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02712 
02713       if (key_name[0] == 0 || strcmp(key_name, "/") == 0) {
02714          if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
02715             *subhKey = 0;
02716             return DB_NO_ACCESS;
02717          }
02718 
02719          *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02720 
02721          return DB_SUCCESS;
02722       }
02723 
02724       pkey_name = key_name;
02725       do {
02726          /* extract single subkey from key_name */
02727          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str);
02728 
02729          /* check if parent or current directory */
02730          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
02731             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
02732                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02733                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02734             }
02735             continue;
02736          }
02737          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
02738             continue;
02739 
02740          /* check if key is in keylist */
02741          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
02742 
02743          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
02744             if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
02745                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link1",
02746                       "Warning: database corruption, key \"%s\", next_key 0x%08X",
02747                       key_name, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
02748                *subhKey = 0;
02749                return DB_CORRUPTED;
02750             }
02751 
02752             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
02753                break;
02754 
02755             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
02756          }
02757 
02758          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
02759             *subhKey = 0;
02760             return DB_NO_KEY;
02761          }
02762 
02763          /* resolve links if not last in chain */
02764          if (pkey->type == TID_LINK && *pkey_name == '/') {
02765             /* copy destination, strip '/' */
02766             strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02767             if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
02768                str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
02769 
02770             /* append rest of key name */
02771             strcat(str, pkey_name);
02772             return db_find_link1(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02773          }
02774 
02775          /* key found: check if last in chain */
02776          if ((*pkey_name == '/')) {
02777             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02778                *subhKey = 0;
02779                return DB_NO_KEY;
02780             }
02781          }
02782 
02783          /* descend one level */
02784          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02785 
02786       } while (*pkey_name == '/' && *(pkey_name + 1));
02787 
02788       *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02789    }
02790 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02791 
02792    return DB_SUCCESS;
02793 }
02794 
02795 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02796 INT db_scan_tree(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT level,
02797                  INT(*callback) (HNDLE, HNDLE, KEY *, INT, void *), void *info)
02798 /********************************************************************\
02799 
02800   Routine: db_scan_tree
02801 
02802   Purpose: Scan a subtree recursively and call 'callback' for each key
02803 
02804   Input:
02805     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
02806     HNDLE  hKeyRoot         Key to start scan from, 0 for root
02807     INT    level            Recursion level
02808     void   *callback        Callback routine called with params:
02809                               hDB   Copy of hDB
02810                               hKey  Copy of hKey
02811                               key   Key associated with hKey
02812                               INT   Recursion level
02813                               info  Copy of *info
02814     void   *info            Optional data copied to callback routine
02815 
02816   Output:
02817     implicit via callback
02818 
02819   Function value:
02820     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02821     <all error codes of db_get_key>
02822 
02823 \********************************************************************/
02824 {
02825    HNDLE hSubkey;
02826    KEY key;
02827    INT i, status;
02828 
02829    status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
02830    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02831       return status;
02832 
02833    status = callback(hDB, hKey, &key, level, info);
02834    if (status == 0)
02835       return status;
02836 
02837    if (key.type == TID_KEY) {
02838       for (i = 0;; i++) {
02839          db_enum_key(hDB, hKey, i, &hSubkey);
02840 
02841          if (!hSubkey)
02842             break;
02843 
02844          db_scan_tree(hDB, hSubkey, level + 1, callback, info);
02845       }
02846    }
02847 
02848    return DB_SUCCESS;
02849 }
02850 
02851 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02852 INT db_scan_tree_link(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT level,
02853                       void (*callback) (HNDLE, HNDLE, KEY *, INT, void *), void *info)
02854 /********************************************************************\
02855 
02856   Routine: db_scan_tree_link
02857 
02858   Purpose: Scan a subtree recursively and call 'callback' for each key.
02859            Similar to db_scan_tree but without follwing links.
02860 
02861   Input:
02862     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
02863     HNDLE  hKeyRoot         Key to start scan from, 0 for root
02864     INT    level            Recursion level
02865     void   *callback        Callback routine called with params:
02866                               hDB   Copy of hDB
02867                               hKey  Copy of hKey
02868                               key   Key associated with hKey
02869                               INT   Recursion level
02870                               info  Copy of *info
02871     void   *info            Optional data copied to callback routine
02872 
02873   Output:
02874     implicit via callback
02875 
02876   Function value:
02877     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02878     <all error codes of db_get_key>
02879 
02880 \********************************************************************/
02881 {
02882    HNDLE hSubkey;
02883    KEY key;
02884    INT i, status;
02885 
02886    status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
02887    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
02888       return status;
02889 
02890    callback(hDB, hKey, &key, level, info);
02891 
02892    if (key.type == TID_KEY) {
02893       for (i = 0;; i++) {
02894          db_enum_link(hDB, hKey, i, &hSubkey);
02895 
02896          if (!hSubkey)
02897             break;
02898 
02899          db_scan_tree_link(hDB, hSubkey, level + 1, callback, info);
02900       }
02901    }
02902 
02903    return DB_SUCCESS;
02904 }
02905 
02906 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02907 INT db_get_path(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *path, INT buf_size)
02908 /********************************************************************\
02909 
02910   Routine: db_get_path
02911 
02912   Purpose: Get full path of a key
02913 
02914   Input:
02915     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
02916     HNDLE  hKey             Key handle
02917     INT    buf_size         Maximum size of path buffer (including
02918                             trailing zero)
02919 
02920   Output:
02921     char   path[buf_size]   Path string
02922 
02923   Function value:
02924     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02925     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
02926     DB_NO_MEMORY            path buffer is to small to contain full
02927                             string
02928 
02929 \********************************************************************/
02930 {
02931    if (rpc_is_remote())
02932       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_PATH, hDB, hKey, path, buf_size);
02933 
02934 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02935    {
02936       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02937       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02938       KEY *pkey;
02939       char str[MAX_ODB_PATH];
02940 
02941       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02942          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_path", "invalid database handle");
02943          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02944       }
02945 
02946       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02947          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_path", "invalid database handle");
02948          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02949       }
02950 
02951       db_lock_database(hDB);
02952 
02953       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02954       if (!hKey)
02955          hKey = pheader->root_key;
02956       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02957 
02958       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02959       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02960          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02961          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02962       }
02963 
02964       if (hKey == pheader->root_key) {
02965          strcpy(path, "/");
02966          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02967          return DB_SUCCESS;
02968       }
02969 
02970       *path = 0;
02971       do {
02972          /* add key name in front of path */
02973          strcpy(str, path);
02974          strcpy(path, "/");
02975          strcat(path, pkey->name);
02976 
02977          if (strlen(path) + strlen(str) + 1 > (DWORD) buf_size) {
02978             *path = 0;
02979             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02980             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
02981          }
02982          strcat(path, str);
02983 
02984          /* find parent key */
02985          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02986          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02987       } while (pkey->parent_keylist);
02988 
02989       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02990    }
02991 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02992 
02993    return DB_SUCCESS;
02994 }
02995 
02996 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02997 void db_find_open_records(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, KEY * key, INT level, void *result)
02998 {
02999 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03000    DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03001    DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
03002    INT i, j;
03003    char line[256], str[80];
03004 
03005    /* check if this key has notify count set */
03006    if (key->notify_count) {
03007       db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
03008       sprintf(line, "%s open %d times by ", str, key->notify_count);
03009 
03010       db_lock_database(hDB);
03011       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03012 
03013       for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++) {
03014          pclient = &pheader->client[i];
03015          for (j = 0; j < pclient->max_index; j++)
03016             if (pclient->open_record[j].handle == hKey)
03017                sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s ", pclient->name);
03018       }
03019       strcat(line, "\n");
03020       strcat((char *) result, line);
03021 
03022       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03023    }
03024 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03025 }
03026 
03027 void db_fix_open_records(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, KEY * key, INT level, void *result)
03028 {
03029 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03030    DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03031    DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
03032    INT i, j;
03033    char str[256];
03034    KEY *pkey;
03035 
03036    /* check if this key has notify count set */
03037    if (key->notify_count) {
03038       db_lock_database(hDB);
03039       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03040 
03041       for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++) {
03042          pclient = &pheader->client[i];
03043          for (j = 0; j < pclient->max_index; j++)
03044             if (pclient->open_record[j].handle == hKey)
03045                break;
03046          if (j < pclient->max_index)
03047             break;
03048       }
03049       if (i == pheader->max_client_index) {
03050          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
03051          strcat(str, " fixed\n");
03052          strcat((char *) result, str);
03053 
03054          /* reset notify count */
03055          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03056          pkey->notify_count = 0;
03057       }
03058 
03059       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03060    }
03061 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03062 }
03063 
03064 INT db_get_open_records(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *str, INT buf_size, BOOL fix)
03065 /********************************************************************\
03066 
03067   Routine: db_get_open_records
03068 
03069   Purpose: Return a string with all open records
03070 
03071   Input:
03072     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
03073     HNDLE  hKey             Key to start search from, 0 for root
03074     INT    buf_size         Size of string
03075     INT    fix              If TRUE, fix records which are open
03076                             but have no client belonging to it.
03077 
03078   Output:
03079     char   *str             Result string. Individual records are
03080                             separated with new lines.
03081 
03082   Function value:
03083     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03084 
03085 \********************************************************************/
03086 {
03087    str[0] = 0;
03088 
03089    if (rpc_is_remote())
03090       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_OPEN_RECORDS, hDB, hKey, str, buf_size);
03091 
03092    if (fix)
03093       db_scan_tree_link(hDB, hKey, 0, db_fix_open_records, str);
03094    else
03095       db_scan_tree_link(hDB, hKey, 0, db_find_open_records, str);
03096 
03097    return DB_SUCCESS;
03098 }
03099 
03101 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
03102 
03103 /********************************************************************/
03128 INT db_set_value(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyRoot, char *key_name, void *data,
03129                  INT data_size, INT num_values, DWORD type)
03130 {
03131    if (rpc_is_remote())
03132       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_VALUE, hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name,
03133                       data, data_size, num_values, type);
03134 
03135 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03136    {
03137       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03138       KEY *pkey;
03139       HNDLE hKey;
03140       INT status;
03141 
03142       if (num_values == 0)
03143          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
03144 
03145       status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hKey);
03146       if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
03147          db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, type);
03148          status = db_find_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hKey);
03149       }
03150 
03151       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03152          return status;
03153 
03154       db_lock_database(hDB);
03155       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03156 
03157       /* get address from handle */
03158       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03159 
03160       /* check for write access */
03161       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
03162          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03163          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
03164       }
03165 
03166       if (pkey->type != type) {
03167          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03168          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
03169                 key_name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
03170          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03171       }
03172 
03173       /* keys cannot contain data */
03174       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
03175          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03176          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value", "key cannot contain data");
03177          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03178       }
03179 
03180       if (data_size == 0) {
03181          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03182          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value", "zero data size not allowed");
03183          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03184       }
03185 
03186       if (type != TID_STRING && type != TID_LINK &&
03187           data_size != rpc_tid_size(type) * num_values) {
03188          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03189          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value",
03190                 "data_size (%d) does not match num_values (%d)", data_size, num_values);
03191          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03192       }
03193 
03194       /* resize data size if necessary */
03195       if (pkey->total_size < data_size) {
03196          pkey->data =
03197              (PTYPE) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data,
03198                                   pkey->total_size, data_size);
03199 
03200          if (pkey->data == 0) {
03201             db_unlock_database(hDB);
03202             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value", "online database full");
03203             return DB_FULL;
03204          }
03205 
03206          pkey->data -= (PTYPE) pheader;
03207          pkey->total_size = data_size;
03208       }
03209 
03210       /* set number of values */
03211       pkey->num_values = num_values;
03212 
03213       if (type == TID_STRING || type == TID_LINK)
03214          pkey->item_size = data_size / num_values;
03215       else
03216          pkey->item_size = rpc_tid_size(type);
03217 
03218       /* copy data */
03219       memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data, data, data_size);
03220 
03221       /* update time */
03222       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
03223 
03224       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
03225       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03226 
03227    }
03228 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03229 
03230    return DB_SUCCESS;
03231 }
03232 
03233 /********************************************************************/
03261 INT db_get_value(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyRoot, char *key_name, void *data,
03262                  INT * buf_size, DWORD type, BOOL create)
03263 {
03264    if (rpc_is_remote())
03265       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_VALUE, hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name,
03266                       data, buf_size, type, create);
03267 
03268 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03269    {
03270       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03271       HNDLE hkey;
03272       KEY *pkey;
03273       INT status, size;
03274       char path[256];
03275 
03276       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03277          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "invalid database handle");
03278          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03279       }
03280 
03281       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03282          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "invalid database handle");
03283          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03284       }
03285 
03286       status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hkey);
03287       if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
03288          if (create) {
03289             db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, type);
03290             status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hkey);
03291             if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03292                return status;
03293 
03294             /* get string size from data size */
03295             if (type == TID_STRING || type == TID_LINK)
03296                size = *buf_size;
03297             else
03298                size = rpc_tid_size(type);
03299 
03300             if (size == 0)
03301                return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03302 
03303             /* set default value if key was created */
03304             status = db_set_value(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, data,
03305                                   *buf_size, *buf_size / size, type);
03306          } else
03307             return DB_NO_KEY;
03308       }
03309 
03310       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03311          return status;
03312 
03313       /* now lock database */
03314       db_lock_database(hDB);
03315       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03316 
03317       /* get address from handle */
03318       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hkey);
03319 
03320       /* check for correct type */
03321       if (pkey->type != (type)) {
03322          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03323          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
03324                 key_name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
03325          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03326       }
03327 
03328       /* check for read access */
03329       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
03330          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03331          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "%s has no read access", key_name);
03332          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
03333       }
03334 
03335       /* check if buffer is too small */
03336       if (pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size > *buf_size) {
03337          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, *buf_size);
03338          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03339          db_get_path(hDB, hkey, path, sizeof(path));
03340          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value",
03341                 "buffer too small, data truncated for key \"%s\"", path);
03342          return DB_TRUNCATED;
03343       }
03344 
03345       /* copy key data */
03346       memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size);
03347       *buf_size = pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size;
03348 
03349       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03350    }
03351 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03352 
03353    return DB_SUCCESS;
03354 }
03355 
03356 /********************************************************************/
03390 INT db_enum_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT index, HNDLE * subkey_handle)
03391 {
03392    if (rpc_is_remote())
03393       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_ENUM_KEY, hDB, hKey, index, subkey_handle);
03394 
03395 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03396    {
03397       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03398       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
03399       KEY *pkey;
03400       INT i;
03401       char str[256];
03402       HNDLE parent;
03403 
03404       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03405          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_key", "invalid database handle");
03406          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03407       }
03408 
03409       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03410          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_key", "invalid database handle");
03411          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03412       }
03413 
03414       *subkey_handle = 0;
03415 
03416       /* first lock database */
03417       db_lock_database(hDB);
03418 
03419       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03420       if (!hKey)
03421          hKey = pheader->root_key;
03422       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03423 
03424       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03425       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03426          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03427          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03428       }
03429 
03430       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
03431          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03432          return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03433       }
03434       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03435 
03436       if (index >= pkeylist->num_keys) {
03437          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03438          return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03439       }
03440 
03441       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
03442       for (i = 0; i < index; i++)
03443          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
03444 
03445       /* resolve links */
03446       if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
03447          strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03448 
03449          if (*str == '/') {
03450             /* absolute path */
03451             db_unlock_database(hDB);
03452             return db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, subkey_handle);
03453          } else {
03454             /* relative path */
03455             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
03456                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
03457                parent = pkeylist->parent;
03458                db_unlock_database(hDB);
03459                return db_find_key(hDB, parent, str, subkey_handle);
03460             } else {
03461                db_unlock_database(hDB);
03462                return db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, subkey_handle);
03463             }
03464          }
03465       }
03466 
03467       *subkey_handle = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
03468       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03469    }
03470 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03471 
03472    return DB_SUCCESS;
03473 }
03474 
03476 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
03477 
03478 
03479 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03480 INT db_enum_link(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT index, HNDLE * subkey_handle)
03481 /********************************************************************\
03482 
03483   Routine: db_enum_link
03484 
03485   Purpose: Enumerate subkeys from a key, don't follow links
03486 
03487   Input:
03488     HNDLE hDB               Handle to the database
03489     HNDLE hKey              Handle of key to enumerate, zero for the
03490                             root key
03491     INT   index             Subkey index, sould be initially 0, then
03492                             incremented in each call until
03493                             *subhKey becomes zero and the function
03494                             returns DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS
03495 
03496   Output:
03497     HNDLE *subkey_handle    Handle of subkey which can be used in
03498                             db_get_key and db_get_data
03499 
03500   Function value:
03501     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03502     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
03503     DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS      Last subkey reached
03504 
03505 \********************************************************************/
03506 {
03507    if (rpc_is_remote())
03508       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_ENUM_LINK, hDB, hKey, index, subkey_handle);
03509 
03510 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03511    {
03512       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03513       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
03514       KEY *pkey;
03515       INT i;
03516 
03517       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03518          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_link", "invalid database handle");
03519          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03520       }
03521 
03522       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03523          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_link", "invalid database handle");
03524          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03525       }
03526 
03527       *subkey_handle = 0;
03528 
03529       /* first lock database */
03530       db_lock_database(hDB);
03531 
03532       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03533       if (!hKey)
03534          hKey = pheader->root_key;
03535       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03536 
03537       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03538       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03539          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03540          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03541       }
03542 
03543       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
03544          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03545          return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03546       }
03547       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03548 
03549       if (index >= pkeylist->num_keys) {
03550          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03551          return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03552       }
03553 
03554       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
03555       for (i = 0; i < index; i++)
03556          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
03557 
03558       *subkey_handle = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
03559       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03560    }
03561 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03562 
03563    return DB_SUCCESS;
03564 }
03565 
03566 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03567 INT db_get_next_link(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, HNDLE * subkey_handle)
03568 /********************************************************************\
03569 
03570   Routine: db_get_next_link
03571 
03572   Purpose: Get next key in ODB after hKey
03573 
03574   Input:
03575     HNDLE hDB               Handle to the database
03576     HNDLE hKey              Handle of key to enumerate, zero for the
03577                             root key
03578 
03579   Output:
03580     HNDLE *subkey_handle    Handle of subkey which can be used in
03581                             db_get_key and db_get_data
03582 
03583   Function value:
03584     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03585     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
03586     DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS      Last subkey reached
03587 
03588 \********************************************************************/
03589 {
03590    if (rpc_is_remote())
03591       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_NEXT_LINK, hDB, hKey, subkey_handle);
03592 
03593 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03594    {
03595       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03596       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
03597       KEY *pkey;
03598       INT descent;
03599 
03600       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03601          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_link", "invalid database handle");
03602          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03603       }
03604 
03605       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03606          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_link", "invalid database handle");
03607          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03608       }
03609 
03610       *subkey_handle = 0;
03611 
03612       /* first lock database */
03613       db_lock_database(hDB);
03614 
03615       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03616       if (!hKey)
03617          hKey = pheader->root_key;
03618       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03619 
03620       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03621       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03622          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03623          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03624       }
03625 
03626       descent = TRUE;
03627       do {
03628          if (pkey->type != TID_KEY || !descent) {
03629             if (pkey->next_key) {
03630                /* key has next key, return it */
03631                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
03632 
03633                if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
03634                   *subkey_handle = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
03635                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
03636                   return DB_SUCCESS;
03637                }
03638 
03639                /* key has subkeys, so descent on the next iteration */
03640                descent = TRUE;
03641             } else {
03642                if (pkey->parent_keylist == 0) {
03643                   /* return if we are back to the root key */
03644                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
03645                   return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03646                }
03647 
03648                /* key is last in list, traverse up */
03649                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
03650 
03651                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
03652                descent = FALSE;
03653             }
03654          } else {
03655             if (descent) {
03656                /* find first subkey */
03657                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03658 
03659                if (pkeylist->num_keys == 0) {
03660                   /* if key has no subkeys, look for next key on this level */
03661                   descent = FALSE;
03662                } else {
03663                   /* get first subkey */
03664                   pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
03665 
03666                   if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
03667                      *subkey_handle = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
03668                      db_unlock_database(hDB);
03669                      return DB_SUCCESS;
03670                   }
03671                }
03672             }
03673          }
03674 
03675       } while (TRUE);
03676    }
03677 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03678 
03679    return DB_SUCCESS;
03680 }
03681 
03683 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
03684 
03685 /********************************************************************/
03722 INT db_get_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, KEY * key)
03723 {
03724    if (rpc_is_remote())
03725       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_KEY, hDB, hKey, key);
03726 
03727 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03728    {
03729       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03730       KEY *pkey;
03731 
03732       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03733          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid database handle");
03734          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03735       }
03736 
03737       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03738          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid database handle");
03739          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03740       }
03741 
03742       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
03743          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid key handle");
03744          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03745       }
03746 
03747       db_lock_database(hDB);
03748 
03749       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03750       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03751 
03752       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03753       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03754          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03755          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03756       }
03757 
03758       if (!pkey->type) {
03759          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03760          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid key");
03761          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03762       }
03763 
03764       memcpy(key, pkey, sizeof(KEY));
03765 
03766       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03767 
03768    }
03769 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03770 
03771    return DB_SUCCESS;
03772 }
03773 
03774 /********************************************************************/
03782 INT db_get_key_time(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, DWORD * delta)
03783 {
03784    if (rpc_is_remote())
03785       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_KEY_TIME, hDB, hKey, delta);
03786 
03787 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03788    {
03789       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03790       KEY *pkey;
03791 
03792       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03793          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid database handle");
03794          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03795       }
03796 
03797       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03798          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid database handle");
03799          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03800       }
03801 
03802       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
03803          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key", "invalid key handle");
03804          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03805       }
03806 
03807       db_lock_database(hDB);
03808 
03809       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03810       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03811 
03812       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03813       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03814          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03815          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03816       }
03817 
03818       *delta = ss_time() - pkey->last_written;
03819 
03820       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03821 
03822    }
03823 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03824 
03825    return DB_SUCCESS;
03826 }
03827 
03828 /********************************************************************/
03840 INT db_get_key_info(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *name, INT name_size,
03841                     INT * type, INT * num_values, INT * item_size)
03842 {
03843    if (rpc_is_remote())
03844       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_KEY_INFO, hDB, hKey, name, name_size,
03845                       type, num_values, item_size);
03846 
03847 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03848    {
03849       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03850       KEY *pkey;
03851       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
03852 
03853       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03854          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key_info", "invalid database handle");
03855          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03856       }
03857 
03858       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03859          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key_info", "invalid database handle");
03860          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03861       }
03862 
03863       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
03864          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_key_info", "invalid key handle");
03865          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03866       }
03867 
03868       db_lock_database(hDB);
03869 
03870       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03871       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03872 
03873       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03874       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03875          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03876          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03877       }
03878 
03879       if ((INT) strlen(pkey->name) + 1 > name_size) {
03880          /* truncate name */
03881          memcpy(name, pkey->name, name_size - 1);
03882          name[name_size] = 0;
03883       } else
03884          strcpy(name, pkey->name);
03885 
03886       /* convert "root" to "/" */
03887       if (strcmp(name, "root") == 0)
03888          strcpy(name, "/");
03889 
03890       *type = pkey->type;
03891       *num_values = pkey->num_values;
03892       *item_size = pkey->item_size;
03893 
03894       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
03895          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03896          *num_values = pkeylist->num_keys;
03897       }
03898 
03899       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03900    }
03901 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03902 
03903    return DB_SUCCESS;
03904 }
