03910 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03911 INT db_rename_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *name)
03912 /********************************************************************\
03913 
03914   Routine: db_get_key
03915 
03916   Purpose: Rename a key
03917 
03918   Input:
03919     HNDLE hDB               Handle to the database
03920     HNDLE hKey              Handle of key
03921     char  *name             New key name
03922 
03923   Output:
03924     <none>
03925 
03926   Function value:
03927     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03928     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
03929 
03930 \********************************************************************/
03931 {
03932    if (rpc_is_remote())
03933       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_RENAME_KEY, hDB, hKey, name);
03934 
03935 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03936    {
03937       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03938       KEY *pkey;
03939 
03940       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03941          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid database handle");
03942          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03943       }
03944 
03945       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03946          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid database handle");
03947          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03948       }
03949 
03950       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
03951          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid key handle");
03952          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03953       }
03954 
03955       db_lock_database(hDB);
03956 
03957       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03958       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03959 
03960       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03961       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03962          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03963          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03964       }
03965 
03966       if (!pkey->type) {
03967          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03968          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid key");
03969          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03970       }
03971 
03972       name[NAME_LENGTH] = 0;
03973       strcpy(pkey->name, name);
03974 
03975       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03976 
03977    }
03978 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03979 
03980    return DB_SUCCESS;
03981 }
03982 
03983 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03984 INT db_reorder_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT index)
03985 /********************************************************************\
03986 
03987   Routine: db_reorder_key
03988 
03989   Purpose: Reorder key so that key hKey apprears at position 'index'
03990            in keylist (or at bottom if index<0)
03991 
03992   Input:
03993     HNDLE hDB               Handle to the database
03994     HNDLE hKey              Handle of key
03995     INT   index             New positio of key in keylist
03996 
03997   Output:
03998     <none>
03999 
04000   Function value:
04001     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04002     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
04003     DB_NO_ACCESS            Key is locked for write
04004     DB_OPEN_RECORD          Key, subkey or parent key is open
04005 
04006 \********************************************************************/
04007 {
04008    if (rpc_is_remote())
04009       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_REORDER_KEY, hDB, hKey, index);
04010 
04011 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04012    {
04013       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04014       KEY *pkey, *pprev_key, *pnext_key, *pkey_tmp;
04015       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
04016       INT i;
04017 
04018       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04019          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid database handle");
04020          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04021       }
04022 
04023       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04024          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid database handle");
04025          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04026       }
04027 
04028       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04029          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid key handle");
04030          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04031       }
04032 
04033       db_lock_database(hDB);
04034 
04035       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04036       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04037 
04038       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04039       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04040          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04041          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04042       }
04043 
04044       if (!pkey->type) {
04045          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04046          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_reorder_key", "invalid key");
04047          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04048       }
04049 
04050       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE)) {
04051          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04052          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04053       }
04054 
04055       /* check if someone has opened key or parent */
04056       do {
04057          if (pkey->notify_count) {
04058             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04059             return DB_OPEN_RECORD;
04060          }
04061 
04062          if (pkey->parent_keylist == 0)
04063             break;
04064 
04065          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
04066          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
04067       } while (TRUE);
04068 
04069       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04070       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
04071 
04072       /* first remove key from list */
04073       pnext_key = (KEY *) (PTYPE) pkey->next_key;
04074 
04075       if ((KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key) == pkey) {
04076          /* key is first in list */
04077          pkeylist->first_key = (PTYPE) pnext_key;
04078       } else {
04079          /* find predecessor */
04080          pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
04081          while ((KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key) != pkey)
04082             pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key);
04083          pkey_tmp->next_key = (PTYPE) pnext_key;
04084       }
04085 
04086       /* add key to list at proper index */
04087       pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
04088       if (index < 0 || index >= pkeylist->num_keys - 1) {
04089          /* add at bottom */
04090 
04091          /* find last key */
04092          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys - 2; i++) {
04093             pprev_key = pkey_tmp;
04094             pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key);
04095          }
04096 
04097          pkey_tmp->next_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
04098          pkey->next_key = 0;
04099       } else {
04100          if (index == 0) {
04101             /* add at top */
04102             pkey->next_key = pkeylist->first_key;
04103             pkeylist->first_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
04104          } else {
04105             /* add at position index */
04106             for (i = 0; i < index - 1; i++)
04107                pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key);
04108 
04109             pkey->next_key = pkey_tmp->next_key;
04110             pkey_tmp->next_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
04111          }
04112       }
04113 
04114       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04115 
04116    }
04117 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04118 
04119    return DB_SUCCESS;
04120 }
04121 
04123 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
04124 
04125 
04126 /********************************************************************/
04150 INT db_get_data(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *data, INT * buf_size, DWORD type)
04151 {
04152    if (rpc_is_remote())
04153       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_DATA, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, type);
04154 
04155 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04156    {
04157       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04158       KEY *pkey;
04159 
04160       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04161          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Invalid database handle");
04162          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04163       }
04164 
04165       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04166          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid database handle");
04167          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04168       }
04169 
04170       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04171          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key handle");
04172          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04173       }
04174 
04175       db_lock_database(hDB);
04176 
04177       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04178       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04179 
04180       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04181       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04182          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04183          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04184       }
04185 
04186       /* check for read access */
04187       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
04188          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04189          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04190       }
04191 
04192       if (!pkey->type) {
04193          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04194          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key");
04195          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04196       }
04197 
04198       if (pkey->type != type) {
04199          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04200          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
04201                 pkey->name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04202          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04203       }
04204 
04205       /* keys cannot contain data */
04206       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04207          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04208          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Key cannot contain data");
04209          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04210       }
04211 
04212       /* check if key has data */
04213       if (pkey->data == 0) {
04214          memset(data, 0, *buf_size);
04215          *buf_size = 0;
04216          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04217          return DB_SUCCESS;
04218       }
04219 
04220       /* check if buffer is too small */
04221       if (pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size > *buf_size) {
04222          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, *buf_size);
04223          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04224          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "data for key \"%s\" truncated", pkey->name);
04225          return DB_TRUNCATED;
04226       }
04227 
04228       /* copy key data */
04229       memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size);
04230       *buf_size = pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size;
04231 
04232       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04233 
04234    }
04235 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04236 
04237    return DB_SUCCESS;
04238 }
04239 
04241 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
04242 
04243 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04244 INT db_get_data1(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *data, INT * buf_size,
04245                  DWORD type, INT * num_values)
04246 /********************************************************************\
04247 
04248   Routine: db_get_data1
04249 
04250   Purpose: Get key data from a handle, return number of values
04251 
04252   Input:
04253     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
04254     HNDLE  hKey             Handle of key
04255     INT    *buf_size        Size of data buffer
04256     DWORD  type             Type of data
04257 
04258   Output:
04259     void   *data            Key data
04260     INT    *buf_size        Size of key data
04261     INT    *num_values      Number of values
04262 
04263   Function value:
04264     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04265     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
04266     DB_TRUNCATED            Return buffer is smaller than key data
04267     DB_TYPE_MISMATCH        Type mismatch
04268 
04269 \********************************************************************/
04270 {
04271    if (rpc_is_remote())
04272       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_DATA, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, type);
04273 
04274 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04275    {
04276       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04277       KEY *pkey;
04278 
04279       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04280          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Invalid database handle");
04281          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04282       }
04283 
04284       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04285          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid database handle");
04286          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04287       }
04288 
04289       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04290          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key handle");
04291          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04292       }
04293 
04294       db_lock_database(hDB);
04295 
04296       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04297       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04298 
04299       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04300       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04301          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04302          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04303       }
04304 
04305       /* check for read access */
04306       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
04307          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04308          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04309       }
04310 
04311       if (!pkey->type) {
04312          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04313          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key");
04314          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04315       }
04316 
04317       if (pkey->type != type) {
04318          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04319          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
04320                 pkey->name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04321          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04322       }
04323 
04324       /* keys cannot contain data */
04325       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04326          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04327          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Key cannot contain data");
04328          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04329       }
04330 
04331       /* check if key has data */
04332       if (pkey->data == 0) {
04333          memset(data, 0, *buf_size);
04334          *buf_size = 0;
04335          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04336          return DB_SUCCESS;
04337       }
04338 
04339       /* check if buffer is too small */
04340       if (pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size > *buf_size) {
04341          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, *buf_size);
04342          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04343          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "data for key \"%s\" truncated", pkey->name);
04344          return DB_TRUNCATED;
04345       }
04346 
04347       /* copy key data */
04348       memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size);
04349       *buf_size = pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size;
04350       *num_values = pkey->num_values;
04351 
04352       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04353 
04354    }
04355 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04356 
04357    return DB_SUCCESS;
04358 }

04363 /********************************************************************/
04376 INT db_get_data_index(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey,
04377                       void *data, INT * buf_size, INT index, DWORD type)
04378 {
04379    if (rpc_is_remote())
04380       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_DATA_INDEX, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, index, type);
04381 
04382 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04383    {
04384       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04385       KEY *pkey;
04386       char str[256];
04387 
04388       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04389          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Invalid database handle");
04390          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04391       }
04392 
04393       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04394          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid database handle");
04395          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04396       }
04397 
04398       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04399          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key handle");
04400          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04401       }
04402 
04403       db_lock_database(hDB);
04404 
04405       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04406       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04407 
04408       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04409       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04410          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04411          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04412       }
04413 
04414       /* check for read access */
04415       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
04416          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04417          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04418       }
04419 
04420       if (!pkey->type) {
04421          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04422          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index", "invalid key");
04423          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04424       }
04425 
04426       if (pkey->type != type) {
04427          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04428          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index",
04429                 "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s", pkey->name,
04430                 rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04431          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04432       }
04433 
04434       /* keys cannot contain data */
04435       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04436          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04437          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index", "Key cannot contain data");
04438          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04439       }
04440 
04441       /* check if key has data */
04442       if (pkey->data == 0) {
04443          memset(data, 0, *buf_size);
04444          *buf_size = 0;
04445          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04446          return DB_SUCCESS;
04447       }
04448 
04449       /* check if index in range */
04450       if (index < 0 || index >= pkey->num_values) {
04451          memset(data, 0, *buf_size);
04452          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04453 
04454          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
04455          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index",
04456                 "index (%d) exceeds array length (%d) for key \"%s\"",
04457                 index, pkey->num_values, str);
04458          return DB_OUT_OF_RANGE;
04459       }
04460 
04461       /* check if buffer is too small */
04462       if (pkey->item_size > *buf_size) {
04463          /* copy data */
04464          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data + index * pkey->item_size, *buf_size);
04465          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04466          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index", "data for key \"%s\" truncated", pkey->name);
04467          return DB_TRUNCATED;
04468       }
04469 
04470       /* copy key data */
04471       memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data + index * pkey->item_size,
04472              pkey->item_size);
04473       *buf_size = pkey->item_size;
04474 
04475       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04476 
04477    }
04478 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04479 
04480    return DB_SUCCESS;
04481 }
04482 
04483 /********************************************************************/
04503 INT db_set_data(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey,
04504                 void *data, INT buf_size, INT num_values, DWORD type)
04505 {
04506    if (rpc_is_remote())
04507       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_DATA, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, num_values, type);
04508 
04509 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04510    {
04511       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04512       KEY *pkey;
04513 
04514       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04515          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid database handle");
04516          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04517       }
04518 
04519       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04520          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid database handle");
04521          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04522       }
04523 
04524       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04525          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid key handle");
04526          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04527       }
04528 
04529       if (num_values == 0)
04530          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
04531 
04532       db_lock_database(hDB);
04533 
04534       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04535       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04536 
04537       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04538       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04539          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04540          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04541       }
04542 
04543       /* check for write access */
04544       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
04545          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04546          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04547       }
04548 
04549       if (pkey->type != type) {
04550          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04551          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
04552                 pkey->name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04553          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04554       }
04555 
04556       /* keys cannot contain data */
04557       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04558          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04559          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "Key cannot contain data");
04560          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04561       }
04562 
04563       /* if no buf_size given (Java!), calculate it */
04564       if (buf_size == 0)
04565          buf_size = pkey->item_size * num_values;
04566 
04567       /* resize data size if necessary */
04568       if (pkey->total_size != buf_size) {
04569          pkey->data =
04570              (PTYPE) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data,
04571                                   pkey->total_size, buf_size);
04572 
04573          if (pkey->data == 0) {
04574             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04575             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "online database full");
04576             return DB_FULL;
04577          }
04578 
04579          pkey->data -= (PTYPE) pheader;
04580          pkey->total_size = buf_size;
04581       }
04582 
04583       /* set number of values */
04584       pkey->num_values = num_values;
04585       if (num_values)
04586          pkey->item_size = buf_size / num_values;
04587 
04588       /* copy data */
04589       memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data, data, buf_size);
04590 
04591       /* update time */
04592       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
04593 
04594       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
04595       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04596 
04597    }
04598 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04599 
04600    return DB_SUCCESS;
04601 }
04602 
04604 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS

04606 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04607 INT db_set_num_values(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT num_values)
04608 /********************************************************************\
04609 
04610   Routine: db_set_num_values
04611 
04612   Purpose: Set numbe of values in a key. Extend with zeros or truncate.
04613 
04614   Input:
04615     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
04616     HNDLE  hKey             Handle of key
04617     INT    num_values       Number of data values
04618 
04619   Output:
04620     none
04621 
04622   Function value:
04623     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04624     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
04625 
04626 \********************************************************************/
04627 {
04628    if (rpc_is_remote())
04629       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_NUM_VALUES, hDB, hKey, num_values);
04630 
04631 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04632    {
04633       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04634       KEY *pkey;
04635       INT new_size;
04636 
04637       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04638          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid database handle");
04639          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04640       }
04641 
04642       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04643          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid database handle");
04644          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04645       }
04646 
04647       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04648          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid key handle");
04649          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04650       }
04651 
04652       if (num_values == 0)
04653          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
04654 
04655       db_lock_database(hDB);
04656 
04657       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04658       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04659 
04660       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04661       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04662          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04663          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04664       }
04665 
04666       /* check for write access */
04667       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
04668          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04669          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04670       }
04671 
04672       /* keys cannot contain data */
04673       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04674          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04675          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "Key cannot contain data");
04676          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04677       }
04678 
04679       /* resize data size if necessary */
04680       if (pkey->num_values != num_values) {
04681          new_size = pkey->item_size * num_values;
04682          pkey->data =
04683              (PTYPE) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data,
04684                                   pkey->total_size, new_size);
04685 
04686          if (pkey->data == 0) {
04687             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04688             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "online database full");
04689             return DB_FULL;
04690          }
04691 
04692          pkey->data -= (PTYPE) pheader;
04693          pkey->total_size = new_size;
04694          pkey->num_values = num_values;
04695       }
04696 
04697       /* update time */
04698       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
04699 
04700       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
04701       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04702 
04703    }
04704 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04705 
04706    return DB_SUCCESS;
04707 }
04708 
04710 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
04711 
04712 /********************************************************************/
04727 INT db_set_data_index(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey,
04728                       void *data, INT data_size, INT index, DWORD type)
04729 {
04730    if (rpc_is_remote())
04731       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_DATA_INDEX, hDB, hKey, data, data_size, index, type);
04732 
04733 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04734    {
04735       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04736       KEY *pkey;
04737 
04738       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04739          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "invalid database handle");
04740          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04741       }
04742 
04743       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04744          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "invalid database handle");
04745          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04746       }
04747 
04748       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04749          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "invalid key handle");
04750          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04751       }
04752 
04753       db_lock_database(hDB);
04754 
04755       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04756       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04757 
04758       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04759       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04760          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04761          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04762       }
04763 
04764       /* check for write access */
04765       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
04766          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04767          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04768       }
04769 
04770       if (pkey->type != type) {
04771          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04772          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index",
04773                 "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s", pkey->name,
04774                 rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04775          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04776       }
04777 
04778       /* keys cannot contain data */
04779       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04780          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04781          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "key cannot contain data");
04782          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04783       }
04784 
04785       /* check for valid index */
04786       if (index < 0) {
04787          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04788          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "invalid index");
04789          return DB_FULL;
04790       }
04791 
04792       /* increase data size if necessary */
04793       if (index >= pkey->num_values || pkey->item_size == 0) {
04794          pkey->data =
04795              (PTYPE) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data,
04796                                   pkey->total_size, data_size * (index + 1));
04797 
04798          if (pkey->data == 0) {
04799             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04800             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "online database full");
04801             return DB_FULL;
04802          }
04803 
04804          pkey->data -= (PTYPE) pheader;
04805          if (!pkey->item_size)
04806             pkey->item_size = data_size;
04807          pkey->total_size = data_size * (index + 1);
04808          pkey->num_values = index + 1;
04809       }
04810 
04811       /* cut strings which are too long */
04812       if ((type == TID_STRING || type == TID_LINK) &&
04813           (int) strlen((char *) data) + 1 > pkey->item_size)
04814          *((char *) data + pkey->item_size - 1) = 0;
04815 
04816       /* copy data */
04817       memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data + index * pkey->item_size,
04818              data, pkey->item_size);
04819 
04820       /* update time */
04821       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
04822 
04823       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
04824       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04825 
04826    }
04827 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04828 
04829    return DB_SUCCESS;
04830 }
04831 
04833 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
04834 
04835 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04836 INT db_set_data_index2(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *data,
04837                        INT data_size, INT index, DWORD type, BOOL bNotify)
04838 /********************************************************************\
04839 
04840   Routine: db_set_data_index2
04841 
04842   Purpose: Set key data for a key which contains an array of values.
04843            Optionally notify clients which have key open.
04844 
04845   Input:
04846     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
04847     HNDLE  hKey             Handle of key to enumerate
04848     void   *data            Pointer to single value of data
04849     INT    data_size        Size of single data element
04850     INT    index            Index of array to change [0..n-1]
04851     DWORD  type             Type of data
04852     BOOL   bNotify          If TRUE, notify clients
04853 
04854   Output:
04855     none
04856 
04857   Function value:
04858     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04859     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
04860     DB_TYPE_MISMATCH        Key was created with different type
04861     DB_NO_ACCESS            No write access
04862 
04863 \********************************************************************/
04864 {
04865    if (rpc_is_remote())
04866       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_DATA_INDEX2, hDB, hKey,
04867                       data, data_size, index, type, bNotify);
04868 
04869 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04870    {
04871       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04872       KEY *pkey;
04873 
04874       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04875          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2", "invalid database handle");
04876          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04877       }
04878 
04879       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04880          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2", "invalid database handle");
04881          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04882       }
04883 
04884       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04885          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2", "invalid key handle");
04886          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04887       }
04888 
04889       db_lock_database(hDB);
04890 
04891       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04892       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04893 
04894       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04895       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04896          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04897          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04898       }
04899 
04900       /* check for write access */
04901       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
04902          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04903          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04904       }
04905 
04906       if (pkey->type != type) {
04907          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04908          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2",
04909                 "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s", pkey->name,
04910                 rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04911          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04912       }
04913 
04914       /* keys cannot contain data */
04915       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04916          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04917          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2", "key cannot contain data");
04918          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04919       }
04920 
04921       /* check for valid index */
04922       if (index < 0) {
04923          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04924          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2", "invalid index");
04925          return DB_FULL;
04926       }
04927 
04928       /* increase key size if necessary */
04929       if (index >= pkey->num_values) {
04930          pkey->data =
04931              (PTYPE) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data,
04932                                   pkey->total_size, data_size * (index + 1));
04933 
04934          if (pkey->data == 0) {
04935             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04936             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index2", "online database full");
04937             return DB_FULL;
04938          }
04939 
04940          pkey->data -= (PTYPE) pheader;
04941          if (!pkey->item_size)
04942             pkey->item_size = data_size;
04943          pkey->total_size = data_size * (index + 1);
04944          pkey->num_values = index + 1;
04945       }
04946 
04947       /* cut strings which are too long */
04948       if ((type == TID_STRING || type == TID_LINK) &&
04949           (int) strlen((char *) data) + 1 > pkey->item_size)
04950          *((char *) data + pkey->item_size - 1) = 0;
04951 
04952       /* copy data */
04953       memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data + index * pkey->item_size,
04954              data, pkey->item_size);
04955 
04956       /* update time */
04957       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
04958 
04959       if (bNotify)
04960          db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
04961 
04962       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04963    }
04964 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04965 
04966    return DB_SUCCESS;
04967 }
04968 
04969 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04970 
04971 INT db_merge_data(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyRoot, char *name, void *data,
04972                   INT data_size, INT num_values, INT type)
04973 /********************************************************************\
04974 
04975   Routine: db_merge_data
04976 
04977   Purpose: Merge an array with an ODB array. If the ODB array doesn't
04978            exist, create it and fill it with the array. If it exists,
04979            load it in the array. Adjust ODB array size if necessary.
04980 
04981   Input:
04982     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
04983     HNDLE  hKeyRoot         Key handle to start with, 0 for root
04984     cha    *name            Key name relative to hKeyRoot
04985     void   *data            Pointer to data array
04986     INT    data_size        Size of data array
04987     INT    num_values       Number of values in array
04988     DWORD  type             Type of data
04989 
04990   Output:
04991     none
04992 
04993   Function value:
04994     <same as db_set_data>
04995 
04996 \********************************************************************/
04997 {
04998    HNDLE hKey;
04999    INT status, old_size;
05000 
05001    if (num_values == 0)
05002       return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
05003 
05004    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, name, &hKey);
05005    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
05006       db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, name, type);
05007       db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, name, &hKey);
05008       status = db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data, data_size, num_values, type);
05009    } else {
05010       old_size = data_size;
05011       db_get_data(hDB, hKey, data, &old_size, type);
05012       status = db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data, data_size, num_values, type);
05013    }
05014 
05015    return status;
05016 }
05017 
05018 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05019 INT db_set_mode(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, WORD mode, BOOL recurse)
05020 /********************************************************************\
05021 
05022   Routine: db_set_mode
05023 
05024   Purpose: Set access mode of key
05025 
05026   Input:
05027     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
05028     HNDLE  hKey             Key handle
05029     DWORD  mode             Access mode, any or'ed combination of
05030                             MODE_READ, MODE_WRITE, MODE_EXCLUSIVE
05031                             and MODE_DELETE
05032     BOOL   recurse          Recurse subtree if TRUE, also used
05033                             as recurse level
05034 
05035   Output:
05036     none
05037 
05038   Function value:
05039     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05040     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
05041 
05042 \********************************************************************/
05043 {
05044    if (rpc_is_remote())
05045       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_MODE, hDB, hKey, mode, recurse);
05046 
05047 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05048    {
05049       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
05050       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
05051       KEY *pkey, *pnext_key;
05052       HNDLE hKeyLink;
05053 
05054       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
05055          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_mode", "invalid database handle");
05056          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05057       }
05058 
05059       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
05060          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_mode", "invalid database handle");
05061          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05062       }
05063 
05064       if (recurse < 2)
05065          db_lock_database(hDB);
05066 
05067       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
05068       if (!hKey)
05069          hKey = pheader->root_key;
05070       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
05071 
05072       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
05073       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
05074          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05075          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05076       }
05077 
05078       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
05079 
05080       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY && pkeylist->first_key && recurse) {
05081          /* first recurse subtree */
05082          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
05083 
05084          do {
05085             pnext_key = (KEY *) (PTYPE) pkey->next_key;
05086 
05087             db_set_mode(hDB, (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader, mode, recurse + 1);
05088 
05089             if (pnext_key)
05090                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + (PTYPE) pnext_key);
05091          } while (pnext_key);
05092       }
05093 
05094       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
05095 
05096       /* resolve links */
05097       if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
05098          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05099          if (*((char *) pheader + pkey->data) == '/')
05100             db_find_key(hDB, 0, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, &hKeyLink);
05101          else
05102             db_find_key(hDB, hKey, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, &hKeyLink);
05103          if (hKeyLink)
05104             db_set_mode(hDB, hKeyLink, mode, recurse > 0);
05105          db_lock_database(hDB);
05106          pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
05107          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
05108       }
05109 
05110       /* now set mode */
05111       pkey->access_mode = mode;
05112 
05113       if (recurse < 2)
05114          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05115    }
05116 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05117 
05118    return DB_SUCCESS;
05119 }
05120 
05122 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
05123 
05124 /********************************************************************/
05138 INT db_load(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyRoot, char *filename, BOOL bRemote)
05139 {
05140    struct stat stat_buf;
05141    INT hfile, size, n, i, status;
05142    char *buffer;
05143 
05144    if (rpc_is_remote() && bRemote)
05145       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_LOAD, hDB, hKeyRoot, filename);
05146 
05147    /* open file */
05148    hfile = open(filename, O_RDONLY | O_TEXT, 0644);
05149    if (hfile == -1) {
05150       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_load", "file \"%s\" not found", filename);
05151       return DB_FILE_ERROR;
05152    }
05153 
05154    /* allocate buffer with file size */
05155    fstat(hfile, &stat_buf);
05156    size = stat_buf.st_size;
05157    buffer = (char *) malloc(size + 1);
05158 
05159    if (buffer == NULL) {
05160       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_load", "cannot allocate ODB load buffer");
05161       close(hfile);
05162       return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05163    }
05164 
05165    n = 0;
05166 
05167    do {
05168       i = read(hfile, buffer + n, size);
05169       if (i <= 0)
05170          break;
05171       n += i;
05172    } while (TRUE);
05173 
05174    buffer[n] = 0;
05175 
05176    status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyRoot, buffer);
05177 
05178    close(hfile);
05179    free(buffer);
05180 
05181    return status;
05182 }
05183 
05184 /********************************************************************/
05218 INT db_copy(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *buffer, INT * buffer_size, char *path)
05219 {
05220    INT i, j, size, status;
05221    KEY key;
05222    HNDLE hSubkey;
05223    char full_path[MAX_ODB_PATH], str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH * 2];
05224    char *data, line[MAX_STRING_LENGTH * 2];
05225    BOOL bWritten;
05226 
05227    strcpy(full_path, path);
05228 
05229    bWritten = FALSE;
05230 
05231    /* first enumerate this level */
05232    for (i = 0;; i++) {
05233       db_enum_link(hDB, hKey, i, &hSubkey);
05234 
05235       if (i == 0 && !hSubkey) {
05236          /* If key has no subkeys, just write this key */
05237          db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
05238          size = key.total_size;
05239          data = (char *) malloc(size);
05240          if (data == NULL) {
05241             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_copy", "cannot allocate data buffer");
05242             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05243          }
05244          line[0] = 0;
05245 
05246          if (key.type != TID_KEY) {
05247             db_get_data(hDB, hKey, data, &size, key.type);
05248             if (key.num_values == 1) {
05249                sprintf(line, "%s = %s : ", key.name, tid_name[key.type]);
05250 
05251                if (key.type == TID_STRING && strchr(data, '\n') != NULL) {
05252                   /* multiline string */
05253                   sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[====#$@$#====]\n");
05254 
05255                   /* copy line to buffer */
05256                   if ((INT) (strlen(line) + 1) > *buffer_size) {
05257                      free(data);
05258                      return DB_TRUNCATED;
05259                   }
05260 
05261                   strcpy(buffer, line);
05262                   buffer += strlen(line);
05263                   *buffer_size -= strlen(line);
05264 
05265                   /* copy multiple lines to buffer */
05266                   if (key.item_size > *buffer_size) {
05267                      free(data);
05268                      return DB_TRUNCATED;
05269                   }
05270 
05271                   strcpy(buffer, data);
05272                   buffer += strlen(data);
05273                   *buffer_size -= strlen(data);
05274 
05275                   strcpy(line, "\n====#$@$#====\n");
05276                } else {
05277                   db_sprintf(str, data, key.item_size, 0, key.type);
05278 
05279                   if (key.type == TID_STRING || key.type == TID_LINK)
05280                      sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[%d] ", key.item_size);
05281 
05282                   sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s\n", str);
05283                }
05284             } else {
05285                sprintf(line, "%s = %s[%d] :\n", key.name,
05286                        tid_name[key.type], key.num_values);
05287 
05288                for (j = 0; j < key.num_values; j++) {
05289                   if (key.type == TID_STRING || key.type == TID_LINK)
05290                      sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[%d] ", key.item_size);
05291                   else
05292                      sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[%d] ", j);
05293 
05294                   db_sprintf(str, data, key.item_size, j, key.type);
05295                   sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s\n", str);
05296 
05297                   /* copy line to buffer */
05298                   if ((INT) (strlen(line) + 1) > *buffer_size) {
05299                      free(data);
05300                      return DB_TRUNCATED;
05301                   }
05302 
05303                   strcpy(buffer, line);
05304                   buffer += strlen(line);
05305                   *buffer_size -= strlen(line);
05306                   line[0] = 0;
05307                }
05308             }
05309          }
05310 
05311          /* copy line to buffer */
05312          if ((INT) (strlen(line) + 1) > *buffer_size) {
05313             free(data);
05314             return DB_TRUNCATED;
05315          }
05316 
05317          strcpy(buffer, line);
05318          buffer += strlen(line);
05319          *buffer_size -= strlen(line);
05320 
05321          free(data);
05322       }
05323 
05324       if (!hSubkey)
05325          break;
05326 
05327       db_get_key(hDB, hSubkey, &key);
05328       size = key.total_size;
05329       data = (char *) malloc(size);
05330       if (data == NULL) {
05331          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_copy", "cannot allocate data buffer");
05332          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05333       }
05334 
05335       line[0] = 0;
05336 
05337       if (key.type == TID_KEY) {
05338          /* new line */
05339          if (bWritten) {
05340             if (*buffer_size < 2) {
05341                free(data);
05342                return DB_TRUNCATED;
05343             }
05344 
05345             strcpy(buffer, "\n");
05346             buffer += 1;
05347             *buffer_size -= 1;
05348          }
05349 
05350          strcpy(str, full_path);
05351          if (str[0] && str[strlen(str) - 1] != '/')
05352             strcat(str, "/");
05353          strcat(str, key.name);
05354 
05355          /* recurse */
05356          status = db_copy(hDB, hSubkey, buffer, buffer_size, str);
05357          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
05358             free(data);
05359             return status;
05360          }
05361 
05362          buffer += strlen(buffer);
05363          bWritten = FALSE;
05364       } else {
05365          db_get_data(hDB, hSubkey, data, &size, key.type);
05366          if (!bWritten) {
05367             if (path[0] == 0)
05368                sprintf(line, "[.]\n");
05369             else
05370                sprintf(line, "[%s]\n", path);
05371             bWritten = TRUE;
05372          }
05373 
05374          if (key.num_values == 1) {
05375             sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s = %s : ", key.name, tid_name[key.type]);
05376 
05377             if (key.type == TID_STRING && strchr(data, '\n') != NULL) {
05378                /* multiline string */
05379                sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[====#$@$#====]\n");
05380 
05381                /* ensure string limiter */
05382                data[size - 1] = 0;
05383 
05384                /* copy line to buffer */
05385                if ((INT) (strlen(line) + 1) > *buffer_size) {
05386                   free(data);
05387                   return DB_TRUNCATED;
05388                }
05389 
05390                strcpy(buffer, line);
05391                buffer += strlen(line);
05392                *buffer_size -= strlen(line);
05393 
05394                /* copy multiple lines to buffer */
05395                if (key.item_size > *buffer_size) {
05396                   free(data);
05397                   return DB_TRUNCATED;
05398                }
05399 
05400                strcpy(buffer, data);
05401                buffer += strlen(data);
05402                *buffer_size -= strlen(data);
05403 
05404                strcpy(line, "\n====#$@$#====\n");
05405             } else {
05406                db_sprintf(str, data, key.item_size, 0, key.type);
05407 
05408                if (key.type == TID_STRING || key.type == TID_LINK)
05409                   sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[%d] ", key.item_size);
05410 
05411                sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s\n", str);
05412             }
05413          } else {
05414             sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s = %s[%d] :\n", key.name,
05415                     tid_name[key.type], key.num_values);
05416 
05417             for (j = 0; j < key.num_values; j++) {
05418                if (key.type == TID_STRING || key.type == TID_LINK)
05419                   sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[%d] ", key.item_size);
05420                else
05421                   sprintf(line + strlen(line), "[%d] ", j);
05422 
05423                db_sprintf(str, data, key.item_size, j, key.type);
05424                sprintf(line + strlen(line), "%s\n", str);
05425 
05426                /* copy line to buffer */
05427                if ((INT) (strlen(line) + 1) > *buffer_size) {
05428                   free(data);
05429                   return DB_TRUNCATED;
05430                }
05431 
05432                strcpy(buffer, line);
05433                buffer += strlen(line);
05434                *buffer_size -= strlen(line);
05435                line[0] = 0;
05436             }
05437          }
05438 
05439          /* copy line to buffer */
05440          if ((INT) (strlen(line) + 1) > *buffer_size) {
05441             free(data);
05442             return DB_TRUNCATED;
05443          }
05444 
05445          strcpy(buffer, line);
05446          buffer += strlen(line);
05447          *buffer_size -= strlen(line);
05448       }
05449 
05450       free(data);
05451    }
05452 
05453    if (bWritten) {
05454       if (*buffer_size < 2)
05455          return DB_TRUNCATED;
05456 
05457       strcpy(buffer, "\n");
05458       buffer += 1;
05459       *buffer_size -= 1;
05460    }
05461 
05462    return DB_SUCCESS;
05463 }
05464 
05465 /********************************************************************/
05473 INT db_paste(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKeyRoot, char *buffer)
05474 {
05475    char line[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
05476    char title[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
05477    char key_name[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
05478    char data_str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH + 50];
05479    char test_str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
05480    char *pc, *pold, *data;
05481    INT data_size;
05482    INT tid, i, j, n_data, string_length, status, size;
05483    HNDLE hKey;
05484    KEY root_key;
05485    BOOL multi_line;
05486 
05487    title[0] = 0;
05488    multi_line = FALSE;
05489 
05490    if (hKeyRoot == 0)
05491       db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, "", &hKeyRoot);
05492 
05493    db_get_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, &root_key);
05494 
05495    /* initial data size */
05496    data_size = 1000;
05497    data = (char *) malloc(data_size);
05498    if (data == NULL) {
05499       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "cannot allocate data buffer");
05500       return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05501    }
05502 
05503    do {
05504       if (*buffer == 0)
05505          break;
05506 
05507       for (i = 0; *buffer != '\n' && *buffer && i < MAX_STRING_LENGTH; i++)
05508          line[i] = *buffer++;
05509 
05510       if (i == MAX_STRING_LENGTH) {
05511          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "line too long");
05512          free(data);
05513          return DB_TRUNCATED;
05514       }
05515 
05516       line[i] = 0;
05517       if (*buffer == '\n')
05518          buffer++;
05519 
05520       /* check if it is a section title */
05521       if (line[0] == '[') {
05522          /* extract title and append '/' */
05523          strcpy(title, line + 1);
05524          if (strchr(title, ']'))
05525             *strchr(title, ']') = 0;
05526          if (title[0] && title[strlen(title) - 1] != '/')
05527             strcat(title, "/");
05528       } else {
05529          /* valid data line if it includes '=' and no ';' */
05530          if (strchr(line, '=') && line[0] != ';') {
05531             /* copy type info and data */
05532             pc = strchr(line, '=') + 1;
05533             while (*pc == ' ')
05534                pc++;
05535             strcpy(data_str, pc);
05536 
05537             /* extract key name */
05538             *strchr(line, '=') = 0;
05539 
05540             pc = &line[strlen(line) - 1];
05541             while (*pc == ' ')
05542                *pc-- = 0;
05543 
05544             key_name[0] = 0;
05545             if (title[0] != '.')
05546                strcpy(key_name, title);
05547 
05548             strcat(key_name, line);
05549 
05550             /* evaluate type info */
05551             strcpy(line, data_str);
05552             if (strchr(line, ' '))
05553                *strchr(line, ' ') = 0;
05554 
05555             n_data = 1;
05556             if (strchr(line, '[')) {
05557                n_data = atol(strchr(line, '[') + 1);
05558                *strchr(line, '[') = 0;
05559             }
05560 
05561             for (tid = 0; tid < TID_LAST; tid++)
05562                if (strcmp(tid_name[tid], line) == 0)
05563                   break;
05564 
05565             string_length = 0;
05566 
05567             if (tid == TID_LAST)
05568                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste",
05569                       "found unknown data type \"%s\" in ODB file", line);
05570             else {
05571                /* skip type info */
05572                pc = data_str;
05573                while (*pc != ' ' && *pc)
05574                   pc++;
05575                while ((*pc == ' ' || *pc == ':') && *pc)
05576                   pc++;
05577                strcpy(data_str, pc);
05578 
05579                if (n_data > 1) {
05580                   data_str[0] = 0;
05581                   if (!*buffer)
05582                      break;
05583 
05584                   for (j = 0; *buffer != '\n' && *buffer; j++)
05585                      data_str[j] = *buffer++;
05586                   data_str[j] = 0;
05587                   if (*buffer == '\n')
05588                      buffer++;
05589                }
05590 
05591                for (i = 0; i < n_data; i++) {
05592                   /* strip trailing \n */
05593                   pc = &data_str[strlen(data_str) - 1];
05594                   while (*pc == '\n' || *pc == '\r')
05595                      *pc-- = 0;
05596 
05597                   if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK) {
05598                      if (!string_length) {
05599                         if (data_str[1] == '=')
05600                            string_length = -1;
05601                         else
05602                            string_length = atoi(data_str + 1);
05603                         if (string_length > MAX_STRING_LENGTH) {
05604                            string_length = MAX_STRING_LENGTH;
05605                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste",
05606                                   "found string exceeding MAX_STRING_LENGTH");
05607                         }
05608                      }
05609 
05610                      if (string_length == -1) {
05611                         /* multi-line string */
05612                         if (strstr(buffer, "\n====#$@$#====\n") != NULL) {
05613                            string_length =
05614                                (PTYPE) strstr(buffer,
05615                                               "\n====#$@$#====\n") - (PTYPE) buffer + 1;
05616 
05617                            if (string_length >= data_size) {
05618                               data_size += string_length + 100;
05619                               data = (char *) realloc(data, data_size);
05620                               if (data == NULL) {
05621                                  cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste",
05622                                         "cannot allocate data buffer");
05623                                  return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05624                               }
05625                            }
05626 
05627                            memset(data, 0, data_size);
05628                            strncpy(data, buffer, string_length);
05629                            data[string_length - 1] = 0;
05630                            buffer =
05631                                strstr(buffer,
05632                                       "\n====#$@$#====\n") + strlen("\n====#$@$#====\n");
05633                         } else
05634                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste",
05635                                   "found multi-line string without termination sequence");
05636                      } else {
05637                         pc = data_str + 2;
05638                         while (*pc && *pc != ' ')
05639                            pc++;
05640                         while (*pc && *pc == ' ')
05641                            pc++;
05642 
05643                         /* limit string size */
05644                         *(pc + string_length - 1) = 0;
05645 
05646                         /* increase data buffer if necessary */
05647                         if (string_length * (i + 1) >= data_size) {
05648                            data_size += 1000;
05649                            data = (char *) realloc(data, data_size);
05650                            if (data == NULL) {
05651                               cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "cannot allocate data buffer");
05652                               return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05653                            }
05654                         }
05655 
05656                         strcpy(data + string_length * i, pc);
05657                      }
05658                   } else {
05659                      pc = data_str;
05660 
05661                      if (n_data > 1 && data_str[0] == '[') {
05662                         pc = strchr(data_str, ']') + 1;
05663                         while (*pc && *pc == ' ')
05664                            pc++;
05665                      }
05666 
05667                      db_sscanf(pc, data, &size, i, tid);
05668 
05669                      /* increase data buffer if necessary */
05670                      if (size * (i + 1) >= data_size) {
05671                         data_size += 1000;
05672                         data = (char *) realloc(data, data_size);
05673                         if (data == NULL) {
05674                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "cannot allocate data buffer");
05675                            return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05676                         }
05677                      }
05678 
05679                   }
05680 
05681                   if (i < n_data - 1) {
05682                      data_str[0] = 0;
05683                      if (!*buffer)
05684                         break;
05685 
05686                      pold = buffer;
05687 
05688                      for (j = 0; *buffer != '\n' && *buffer; j++)
05689                         data_str[j] = *buffer++;
05690                      data_str[j] = 0;
05691                      if (*buffer == '\n')
05692                         buffer++;
05693 
05694                      /* test if valid data */
05695                      if (tid != TID_STRING && tid != TID_LINK) {
05696                         if (data_str[0] == 0 || (strchr(data_str, '=')
05697                                                  && strchr(data_str, ':')))
05698                            buffer = pold;
05699                      }
05700                   }
05701                }
05702 
05703                /* skip system client entries */
05704                strcpy(test_str, key_name);
05705                test_str[15] = 0;
05706 
05707                if (!equal_ustring(test_str, "/System/Clients")) {
05708                   if (root_key.type != TID_KEY) {
05709                      /* root key is destination key */
05710                      hKey = hKeyRoot;
05711                   } else {
05712                      /* create key and set value */
05713                      if (key_name[0] == '/') {
05714                         status = db_find_link(hDB, 0, key_name, &hKey);
05715                         if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
05716                            db_create_key(hDB, 0, key_name, tid);
05717                            status = db_find_link(hDB, 0, key_name, &hKey);
05718                         }
05719                      } else {
05720                         status = db_find_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hKey);
05721                         if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
05722                            db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, tid);
05723                            status = db_find_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hKey);
05724                         }
05725                      }
05726                   }
05727 
05728                   /* set key data if created sucessfully */
05729                   if (hKey) {
05730                      if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
05731                         db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data, string_length * n_data, n_data, tid);
05732                      else
05733                         db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data,
05734                                     rpc_tid_size(tid) * n_data, n_data, tid);
05735                   }
05736                }
05737             }
05738          }
05739       }
05740    } while (TRUE);
05741 
05742    free(data);
05743    return DB_SUCCESS;
05744 }
05745 
05747 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
05748 
05749 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05750 void name2c(char *str)
05751 /********************************************************************\
05752 
05753   Routine: name2c
05754 
05755   Purpose: Convert key name to C name. Internal use only.
05756 
05757 \********************************************************************/
05758 {
05759    if (*str >= '0' && *str <= '9')
05760       *str = '_';
05761 
05762    while (*str) {
05763       if (!(*str >= 'a' && *str <= 'z') &&
05764           !(*str >= 'A' && *str <= 'Z') && !(*str >= '0' && *str <= '9'))
05765          *str = '_';
05766       *str = (char) tolower(*str);
05767       str++;
05768    }
05769 }
05770 
05771 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05772 static void db_save_tree_struct(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, int hfile, INT level)
05773 /********************************************************************\
05774 
05775   Routine: db_save_tree_struct
05776 
05777   Purpose: Save database tree as a C structure. Gets called by
05778            db_save_struct(). Internal use only.
05779 
05780 \********************************************************************/
05781 {
05782    INT i, index;
05783    KEY key;
05784    HNDLE hSubkey;
05785    char line[MAX_ODB_PATH], str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
05786 
05787    /* first enumerate this level */
05788    for (index = 0;; index++) {
05789       db_enum_key(hDB, hKey, index, &hSubkey);
05790 
05791       if (!hSubkey)
05792          break;
05793 
05794       db_get_key(hDB, hSubkey, &key);
05795 
05796       if (key.type != TID_KEY) {
05797          for (i = 0; i <= level; i++)
05798             write(hfile, "  ", 2);
05799 
05800          switch (key.type) {
05801          case TID_SBYTE:
05802          case TID_CHAR:
05803             strcpy(line, "char");
05804             break;
05805          case TID_SHORT:
05806             strcpy(line, "short");
05807             break;
05808          case TID_FLOAT:
05809             strcpy(line, "float");
05810             break;
05811          case TID_DOUBLE:
05812             strcpy(line, "double");
05813             break;
05814          case TID_BITFIELD:
05815             strcpy(line, "unsigned char");
05816             break;
05817          case TID_STRING:
05818             strcpy(line, "char");
05819             break;
05820          case TID_LINK:
05821             strcpy(line, "char");
05822             break;
05823          default:
05824             strcpy(line, tid_name[key.type]);
05825             break;
05826          }
05827 
05828          strcat(line, "                    ");
05829          strcpy(str, key.name);
05830          name2c(str);
05831 
05832          if (key.num_values > 1)
05833             sprintf(str + strlen(str), "[%d]", key.num_values);
05834          if (key.type == TID_STRING || key.type == TID_LINK)
05835             sprintf(str + strlen(str), "[%d]", key.item_size);
05836 
05837          strcpy(line + 10, str);
05838          strcat(line, ";\n");
05839 
05840          write(hfile, line, strlen(line));
05841       } else {
05842          /* recurse subtree */
05843          for (i = 0; i <= level; i++)
05844             write(hfile, "  ", 2);
05845 
05846          sprintf(line, "struct {\n");
05847          write(hfile, line, strlen(line));
05848          db_save_tree_struct(hDB, hSubkey, hfile, level + 1);
05849 
05850          for (i = 0; i <= level; i++)
05851             write(hfile, "  ", 2);
05852 
05853          strcpy(str, key.name);
05854          name2c(str);
05855 
05856          sprintf(line, "} %s;\n", str);
05857          write(hfile, line, strlen(line));
05858       }
05859    }
05860 }
05861 
05863 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
05864 
05865 /********************************************************************/
05878 INT db_save(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *filename, BOOL bRemote)
05879 {
05880    if (rpc_is_remote() && bRemote)
05881       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SAVE, hDB, hKey, filename, bRemote);
05882 
05883 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05884    {
05885       INT hfile, size, buffer_size, n, status;
05886       char *buffer, path[256];
05887 
05888       /* open file */
05889       hfile = open(filename, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_TEXT, 0644);
05890       if (hfile == -1) {
05891          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save", "Cannot open file \"%s\"", filename);
05892          return DB_FILE_ERROR;
05893       }
05894 
05895       db_get_path(hDB, hKey, path, sizeof(path));
05896 
05897       buffer_size = 10000;
05898       do {
05899          buffer = (char *) malloc(buffer_size);
05900          if (buffer == NULL) {
05901             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save", "cannot allocate ODB dump buffer");
05902             break;
05903          }
05904 
05905          size = buffer_size;
05906          status = db_copy(hDB, hKey, buffer, &size, path);
05907          if (status != DB_TRUNCATED) {
05908             n = write(hfile, buffer, buffer_size - size);
05909             free(buffer);
05910 
05911             if (n != buffer_size - size) {
05912                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save", "cannot save .ODB file");
05913                close(hfile);
05914                return DB_FILE_ERROR;
05915             }
05916             break;
05917          }
05918 
05919          /* increase buffer size if truncated */
05920          free(buffer);
05921          buffer_size *= 2;
05922       } while (1);
05923 
05924       close(hfile);
05925 
05926    }
05927 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05928 
05929    return DB_SUCCESS;
05930 }
05931 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05932 
05933 void xml_encode(char *src, int size)
05934 {
05935    int i;
05936    char *dst, *p;
05937 
05938    dst = (char *)malloc(size);
05939    if (dst == NULL)
05940       return;
05941 
05942    *dst = 0;
05943    for (i = 0; i < (int) strlen(src); i++) {
05944       switch (src[i]) {
05945       case '<':
05946          strlcat(dst, "&lt;", size);
05947          break;
05948       case '>':
05949          strlcat(dst, "&gt;", size);
05950          break;
05951       case '&':
05952          strlcat(dst, "&amp;", size);
05953          break;
05954       case '\"':
05955          strlcat(dst, "&quot;",size);
05956          break;
05957       case '\'':
05958          strlcat(dst, "&apos;",size);
05959          break;
05960       default:
05961          if ((int)strlen(dst) >= size) {
05962             free(dst);
05963             return;
05964          }
05965          p = dst+strlen(dst);
05966          *p = src[i];
05967          *(p+1) = 0;
05968       }
05969    }
05970 
05971    strlcpy(src, dst, size);
05972 }
05973 
05974 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05975 
05976 INT db_save_xml_key(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT level, INT fh)
05977 {
05978    INT i, j, index, size, status;
05979    char str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH * 2], line[1000], *data;
05980    HNDLE hSubkey;
05981    KEY key;
05982 
05983    status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
05984    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
05985       return status;
05986 
05987    if (key.type == TID_KEY) {
05988 
05989       /* save opening tag for subtree */
05990       line[0] = 0;
05991       for (i=0 ; i<level ; i++)
05992          strcat(line, "  ");
05993       sprintf(line+strlen(line), "<dir name=\"%s\">\n", key.name);
05994       if (write(fh, line, strlen(line)) != strlen(line))
05995          return 0;
05996 
05997       for (index = 0;; index++) {
05998          db_enum_key(hDB, hKey, index, &hSubkey);
05999 
06000          if (!hSubkey)
06001             break;
06002 
06003          /* save subtree */
06004          status = db_save_xml_key(hDB, hSubkey, level + 1, fh);
06005          if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
06006             return status;
06007       }
06008 
06009       /* save closing tag for subtree */
06010       line[0] = 0;
06011       for (i=0 ; i<level ; i++)
06012          strcat(line, "  ");
06013       sprintf(line+strlen(line), "</dir>\n");
06014       if (write(fh, line, strlen(line)) != strlen(line))
06015          return DB_FILE_ERROR;
06016 
06017    } else {
06018 
06019       /* save key value */
06020 
06021       line[0] = 0;
06022       for (i=0 ; i<level ; i++)
06023          strcat(line, "  ");
06024       sprintf(line+strlen(line), "<key name=\"%s\" type=\"%s\"", key.name, rpc_tid_name(key.type));
06025 
06026       if (key.type == TID_STRING || key.type == TID_LINK)
06027          sprintf(line+strlen(line), " size=\"%d\"", key.item_size);
06028 
06029       if (key.num_values > 1)
06030          sprintf(line+strlen(line), " num_values=\"%d\"", key.num_values);
06031       sprintf(line+strlen(line), ">");
06032 
06033       size = key.total_size;
06034       data = (char *) malloc(size);
06035       if (data == NULL) {
06036          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save_xml_key", "cannot allocate data buffer");
06037          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
06038       }
06039 
06040       db_get_data(hDB, hKey, data, &size, key.type);
06041 
06042       if (key.num_values == 1) {
06043       
06044          db_sprintf(str, data, key.item_size, 0, key.type);
06045          xml_encode(str, sizeof(str));
06046 
06047          strlcat(line, str, sizeof(line));
06048          strlcat(line, "</key>\n", sizeof(line));
06049       
06050       } else { /* array of values */
06051         
06052          strlcat(line, "\n", sizeof(line));
06053          write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06054 
06055          for (i=0 ; i<key.num_values ; i++) {
06056             line[0] = 0;
06057             for (j=0 ; j<level+1 ; j++)
06058                strcat(line, "  ");
06059             strlcat(line, "<value>", sizeof(line));
06060             db_sprintf(str, data, key.item_size, i, key.type);
06061             xml_encode(str, sizeof(str));
06062             strlcat(line, str, sizeof(line));
06063             strlcat(line, "</value>\n", sizeof(line));
06064             write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06065          }
06066 
06067          line[0] = 0;
06068          for (i=0 ; i<level ; i++)
06069             strcat(line, "  ");
06070          strlcat(line, "</key>\n", sizeof(line));
06071       }
06072 
06073       free(data);
06074 
06075       if (write(fh, line, strlen(line)) != strlen(line))
06076          return DB_FILE_ERROR;
06077    }
06078 
06079    return DB_SUCCESS;
06080 }
06081 
06082 /********************************************************************/
06094 INT db_save_xml(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *filename)
06095 {
06096 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06097    {
06098    INT fh, status;
06099    char line[1000], str[256];
06100 
06101    /* open file */
06102    fh = open(filename, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_TEXT, 0644);
06103    if (fh == -1) {
06104       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save_xml", "Cannot open file \"%s\"", filename);
06105       return DB_FILE_ERROR;
06106    }
06107 
06108    /* write XML header */
06109    strcpy(line, "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"ISO-8859-1\"?>\n");
06110    write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06111    cm_asctime(str, sizeof(str));
06112    sprintf(line, "<!-- created by ODBEdit on %s -->\n", str);
06113    write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06114 
06115    status = db_save_xml_key(hDB, hKey, 0, fh);
06116    close(fh);
06117    }
06118 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06119 
06120    return DB_SUCCESS;
06121 }
06122 
06123 /********************************************************************/
06134 INT db_save_struct(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *file_name, char *struct_name, BOOL append)
06135 {
06136    KEY key;
06137    char str[100], line[100];
06138    INT status, i, fh;
06139 
06140    /* open file */
06141    fh = open(file_name, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | (append ? O_APPEND : O_TRUNC), 0644);
06142 
06143    if (fh == -1) {
06144       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save_struct", "Cannot open file\"%s\"", file_name);
06145       return DB_FILE_ERROR;
06146    }
06147 
06148    status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
06149    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
06150       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save_struct", "cannot find key");
06151       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
06152    }
06153 
06154    sprintf(line, "typedef struct {\n");
06155    write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06156    db_save_tree_struct(hDB, hKey, fh, 0);
06157 
06158    if (struct_name && struct_name[0])
06159       strcpy(str, struct_name);
06160    else
06161       strcpy(str, key.name);
06162 
06163    name2c(str);
06164    for (i = 0; i < (int) strlen(str); i++)
06165       str[i] = (char) toupper(str[i]);
06166 
06167    sprintf(line, "} %s;\n\n", str);
06168    write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06169 
06170    close(fh);
06171 
06172    return DB_SUCCESS;
06173 }
06174 
06176 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
06177 
06178 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06179 INT db_save_string(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *file_name, char *string_name, BOOL append)
06180 /********************************************************************\
06181 
06182   Routine: db_save_string
06183 
06184   Purpose: Save a branch of a database as a string which can be used
06185            by db_create_record.
06186 
06187   Input:
06188     HNDLE hDB               Handle to the database
06189     HNDLE hKey              Handle of key to start, 0 for root
06190     int   fh                File handle to write to
06191     char  string_name       Name of string. If struct_name == NULL,
06192                             the name of the key is used.
06193 
06194   Output:
06195     none
06196 
06197   Function value:
06198     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
06199     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
06200 
06201 \********************************************************************/
06202 {
06203    KEY key;
06204    char str[256], line[256];
06205    INT status, i, size, fh, buffer_size;
06206    char *buffer, *pc;
06207 
06208 
06209    /* open file */
06210    fh = open(file_name, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | (append ? O_APPEND : O_TRUNC), 0644);
06211 
06212    if (fh == -1) {
06213       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save_string", "Cannot open file\"%s\"", file_name);
06214       return DB_FILE_ERROR;
06215    }
06216 
06217    status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
06218    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
06219       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save_string", "cannot find key");
06220       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
06221    }
06222 
06223    if (string_name && string_name[0])
06224       strcpy(str, string_name);
06225    else
06226       strcpy(str, key.name);
06227 
06228    name2c(str);
06229    for (i = 0; i < (int) strlen(str); i++)
06230       str[i] = (char) toupper(str[i]);
06231 
06232    sprintf(line, "#define %s(_name) char *_name[] = {\\\n", str);
06233    write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06234 
06235    buffer_size = 10000;
06236    do {
06237       buffer = (char *) malloc(buffer_size);
06238       if (buffer == NULL) {
06239          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save", "cannot allocate ODB dump buffer");
06240          break;
06241       }
06242 
06243       size = buffer_size;
06244       status = db_copy(hDB, hKey, buffer, &size, "");
06245       if (status != DB_TRUNCATED)
06246          break;
06247 
06248       /* increase buffer size if truncated */
06249       free(buffer);
06250       buffer_size *= 2;
06251    } while (1);
06252 
06253 
06254    pc = buffer;
06255 
06256    do {
06257       i = 0;
06258       line[i++] = '"';
06259       while (*pc != '\n' && *pc != 0) {
06260          if (*pc == '\"' || *pc == '\'')
06261             line[i++] = '\\';
06262          line[i++] = *pc++;
06263       }
06264       strcpy(&line[i], "\",\\\n");
06265       if (i > 0)
06266          write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06267 
06268       if (*pc == '\n')
06269          pc++;
06270 
06271    } while (*pc);
06272 
06273    sprintf(line, "NULL }\n\n");
06274    write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06275 
06276    close(fh);
06277    free(buffer);
06278 
06279    return DB_SUCCESS;
06280 }
06281 
06283 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
06284 
06285 /********************************************************************/
06308 INT db_sprintf(char *string, void *data, INT data_size, INT index, DWORD type)
06309 {
06310    if (data_size == 0)
06311       sprintf(string, "<NULL>");
06312    else
06313       switch (type) {
06314       case TID_BYTE:
06315          sprintf(string, "%d", *(((BYTE *) data) + index));
06316          break;
06317       case TID_SBYTE:
06318          sprintf(string, "%d", *(((char *) data) + index));
06319          break;
06320       case TID_CHAR:
06321          sprintf(string, "%c", *(((char *) data) + index));
06322          break;
06323       case TID_WORD:
06324          sprintf(string, "%u", *(((WORD *) data) + index));
06325          break;
06326       case TID_SHORT:
06327          sprintf(string, "%d", *(((short *) data) + index));
06328          break;
06329       case TID_DWORD:
06330          sprintf(string, "%lu", *(((DWORD *) data) + index));
06331          break;
06332       case TID_INT:
06333          sprintf(string, "%d", *(((INT *) data) + index));
06334          break;
06335       case TID_BOOL:
