06336          sprintf(string, "%c", *(((BOOL *) data) + index) ? 'y' : 'n');
06337          break;
06338       case TID_FLOAT:
06339          sprintf(string, "%g", *(((float *) data) + index));
06340          break;
06341       case TID_DOUBLE:
06342          sprintf(string, "%lg", *(((double *) data) + index));
06343          break;
06344       case TID_BITFIELD:
06345          /* TBD */
06346          break;
06347       case TID_STRING:
06348       case TID_LINK:
06349          strlcpy(string, ((char *) data) + data_size * index, MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
06350          break;
06351       default:
06352          sprintf(string, "<unknown>");
06353          break;
06354       }
06355 
06356    return DB_SUCCESS;
06357 }
06358 
06360 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
06361 
06362 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06363 INT db_sprintfh(char *string, void *data, INT data_size, INT index, DWORD type)
06364 /********************************************************************\
06365 
06366   Routine: db_sprintfh
06367 
06368   Purpose: Convert a database value to a string according to its type
06369            in hex format
06370 
06371   Input:
06372     void  *data             Value data
06373     INT   index             Index for array data
06374     INT   data_size         Size of single data element
06375     DWORD type              Valye type, one of TID_xxx
06376 
06377   Output:
06378     char  *string           ASCII string of data
06379 
06380   Function value:
06381     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
06382 
06383 \********************************************************************/
06384 {
06385    if (data_size == 0)
06386       sprintf(string, "<NULL>");
06387    else
06388       switch (type) {
06389       case TID_BYTE:
06390          sprintf(string, "0x%X", *(((BYTE *) data) + index));
06391          break;
06392       case TID_SBYTE:
06393          sprintf(string, "0x%X", *(((char *) data) + index));
06394          break;
06395       case TID_CHAR:
06396          sprintf(string, "%c", *(((char *) data) + index));
06397          break;
06398       case TID_WORD:
06399          sprintf(string, "0x%X", *(((WORD *) data) + index));
06400          break;
06401       case TID_SHORT:
06402          sprintf(string, "0x%hX", *(((short *) data) + index));
06403          break;
06404       case TID_DWORD:
06405          sprintf(string, "0x%lX", *(((DWORD *) data) + index));
06406          break;
06407       case TID_INT:
06408          sprintf(string, "0x%X", *(((INT *) data) + index));
06409          break;
06410       case TID_BOOL:
06411          sprintf(string, "%c", *(((BOOL *) data) + index) ? 'y' : 'n');
06412          break;
06413       case TID_FLOAT:
06414          sprintf(string, "%g", *(((float *) data) + index));
06415          break;
06416       case TID_DOUBLE:
06417          sprintf(string, "%lg", *(((double *) data) + index));
06418          break;
06419       case TID_BITFIELD:
06420          /* TBD */
06421          break;
06422       case TID_STRING:
06423       case TID_LINK:
06424          sprintf(string, "%s", ((char *) data) + data_size * index);
06425          break;
06426       default:
06427          sprintf(string, "<unknown>");
06428          break;
06429       }
06430 
06431    return DB_SUCCESS;
06432 }
06433 
06434 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06435 INT db_sscanf(char *data_str, void *data, INT * data_size, INT i, DWORD tid)
06436 /********************************************************************\
06437 
06438   Routine: db_sscanf
06439 
06440   Purpose: Convert a string to a database value according to its type
06441 
06442   Input:
06443     char  *data_str         ASCII string of data
06444     INT   i                 Index for array data
06445     DWORD tid               Value type, one of TID_xxx
06446 
06447   Output:
06448     void  *data             Value data
06449     INT   *data_size        Size of single data element
06450 
06451   Function value:
06452     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
06453 
06454 \********************************************************************/
06455 {
06456    DWORD value;
06457    BOOL hex = FALSE;
06458 
06459    if (data_str == NULL)
06460       return 0;
06461 
06462    *data_size = rpc_tid_size(tid);
06463    if (strncmp(data_str, "0x", 2) == 0) {
06464       hex = TRUE;
06465       sscanf(data_str + 2, "%lx", &value);
06466    }
06467 
06468    switch (tid) {
06469    case TID_BYTE:
06470    case TID_SBYTE:
06471       if (hex)
06472          *((char *) data + i) = (char) value;
06473       else
06474          *((char *) data + i) = (char) atoi(data_str);
06475       break;
06476    case TID_CHAR:
06477       *((char *) data + i) = data_str[0];
06478       break;
06479    case TID_WORD:
06480       if (hex)
06481          *((WORD *) data + i) = (WORD) value;
06482       else
06483          *((WORD *) data + i) = (WORD) atoi(data_str);
06484       break;
06485    case TID_SHORT:
06486       if (hex)
06487          *((short int *) data + i) = (short int) value;
06488       else
06489          *((short int *) data + i) = (short int) atoi(data_str);
06490       break;
06491    case TID_DWORD:
06492       if (!hex)
06493          sscanf(data_str, "%lu", &value);
06494 
06495       *((DWORD *) data + i) = value;
06496       break;
06497    case TID_INT:
06498       if (hex)
06499          *((INT *) data + i) = value;
06500       else
06501          *((INT *) data + i) = atol(data_str);
06502       break;
06503    case TID_BOOL:
06504       if (data_str[0] == 'y' || data_str[0] == 'Y' || atoi(data_str) > 0)
06505          *((BOOL *) data + i) = 1;
06506       else
06507          *((BOOL *) data + i) = 0;
06508       break;
06509    case TID_FLOAT:
06510       *((float *) data + i) = (float) atof(data_str);
06511       break;
06512    case TID_DOUBLE:
06513       *((double *) data + i) = atof(data_str);
06514       break;
06515    case TID_BITFIELD:
06516       /* TBD */
06517       break;
06518    case TID_STRING:
06519    case TID_LINK:
06520       strcpy((char *) data, data_str);
06521       *data_size = strlen(data_str) + 1;
06522       break;
06523    }
06524 
06525    return DB_SUCCESS;
06526 }
06527 
06528 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06529 
06530 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06531 
06532 static void db_recurse_record_tree(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void **data,
06533                                    INT * total_size, INT base_align,
06534                                    INT * max_align, BOOL bSet, INT convert_flags)
06535 /********************************************************************\
06536 
06537   Routine: db_recurse_record_tree
06538 
06539   Purpose: Recurse a database tree and calculate its size or copy
06540            data. Internal use only.
06541 
06542 \********************************************************************/
06543 {
06544    DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
06545    KEYLIST *pkeylist;
06546    KEY *pkey;
06547    INT size, align, corr, total_size_tmp;
06548 
06549    /* get first subkey of hKey */
06550    pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
06551    pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
06552 
06553    pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
06554    if (!pkeylist->first_key)
06555       return;
06556    pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
06557 
06558    /* first browse through this level */
06559    do {
06560       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
06561          /* correct for alignment */
06562          align = 1;
06563 
06564          if (rpc_tid_size(pkey->type))
06565             align = rpc_tid_size(pkey->type) < base_align ?
06566                 rpc_tid_size(pkey->type) : base_align;
06567 
06568          if (max_align && align > *max_align)
06569             *max_align = align;
06570 
06571          corr = VALIGN(*total_size, align) - *total_size;
06572          *total_size += corr;
06573          if (data)
06574             *data = (void *) ((char *) (*data) + corr);
06575 
06576          /* calculate data size */
06577          size = pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values;
06578 
06579          if (data) {
06580             if (bSet) {
06581                /* copy data if there is write access */
06582                if (pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) {
06583                   memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data, *data,
06584                          pkey->item_size * pkey->num_values);
06585 
06586                   /* convert data */
06587                   if (convert_flags) {
06588                      if (pkey->num_values > 1)
06589                         rpc_convert_data((char *) pheader + pkey->data,
06590                                          pkey->type, RPC_FIXARRAY,
06591                                          pkey->item_size *
06592                                          pkey->num_values, convert_flags);
06593                      else
06594                         rpc_convert_single((char *) pheader + pkey->data,
06595                                            pkey->type, 0, convert_flags);
06596                   }
06597 
06598                   /* update time */
06599                   pkey->last_written = ss_time();
06600 
06601                   /* notify clients which have key open */
06602                   if (pkey->notify_count)
06603                      db_notify_clients(hDB, (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader, FALSE);
06604                }
06605             } else {
06606                /* copy key data if there is read access */
06607                if (pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ) {
06608                   memcpy(*data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->total_size);
06609 
06610                   /* convert data */
06611                   if (convert_flags) {
06612                      if (pkey->num_values > 1)
06613                         rpc_convert_data(*data, pkey->type,
06614                                          RPC_FIXARRAY | RPC_OUTGOING,
06615                                          pkey->item_size *
06616                                          pkey->num_values, convert_flags);
06617                      else
06618                         rpc_convert_single(*data, pkey->type, RPC_OUTGOING,
06619                                            convert_flags);
06620                   }
06621                }
06622             }
06623 
06624             *data = (char *) (*data) + size;
06625          }
06626 
06627          *total_size += size;
06628       } else {
06629          /* align new substructure according to the maximum
06630             align value in this structure */
06631          align = 1;
06632 
06633          total_size_tmp = *total_size;
06634          db_recurse_record_tree(hDB, (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader,
06635                                 NULL, &total_size_tmp,
06636                                 base_align, &align, bSet, convert_flags);
06637 
06638          if (max_align && align > *max_align)
06639             *max_align = align;
06640 
06641          corr = VALIGN(*total_size, align) - *total_size;
06642          *total_size += corr;
06643          if (data)
06644             *data = (void *) ((char *) (*data) + corr);
06645 
06646          /* now copy subtree */
06647          db_recurse_record_tree(hDB, (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader,
06648                                 data, total_size, base_align, NULL, bSet, convert_flags);
06649 
06650          corr = VALIGN(*total_size, align) - *total_size;
06651          *total_size += corr;
06652          if (data)
06653             *data = (void *) ((char *) (*data) + corr);
06654 
06655          if (bSet && pkey->notify_count)
06656             db_notify_clients(hDB, (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader, FALSE);
06657       }
06658 
06659       if (!pkey->next_key)
06660          break;
06661 
06662       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
06663    } while (TRUE);
06664 }
06665 
06666 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06667 
06669 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
06670 
06671 /********************************************************************/
06684 INT db_get_record_size(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, INT align, INT * buf_size)
06685 {
06686    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
06687       align = ss_get_struct_align();
06688       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_RECORD_SIZE, hDB, hKey, align, buf_size);
06689    }
06690 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06691    {
06692       KEY key;
06693       INT status, max_align;
06694 
06695       if (!align)
06696          align = ss_get_struct_align();
06697 
06698       /* check if key has subkeys */
06699       status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
06700       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
06701          return status;
06702 
06703       if (key.type != TID_KEY) {
06704          /* just a single key */
06705          *buf_size = key.item_size * key.num_values;
06706          return DB_SUCCESS;
06707       }
06708 
06709       db_lock_database(hDB);
06710 
06711       /* determine record size */
06712       *buf_size = max_align = 0;
06713       db_recurse_record_tree(hDB, hKey, NULL, buf_size, align, &max_align, 0, 0);
06714 
06715       /* correct for byte padding */
06716       *buf_size = VALIGN(*buf_size, max_align);
06717 
06718       db_unlock_database(hDB);
06719    }
06720 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06721 
06722    return DB_SUCCESS;
06723 }
06724 
06725 /********************************************************************/
06770 INT db_get_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *data, INT * buf_size, INT align)
06771 {
06772    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
06773       align = ss_get_struct_align();
06774       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_RECORD, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, align);
06775    }
06776 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06777    {
06778       KEY key;
06779       INT convert_flags, status;
06780       INT total_size;
06781       void *pdata;
06782       char str[256];
06783 
06784       convert_flags = 0;
06785 
06786       if (!align)
06787          align = ss_get_struct_align();
06788       else
06789          /* only convert data if called remotely, as indicated by align != 0 */
06790       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
06791          convert_flags = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS);
06792 
06793       /* check if key has subkeys */
06794       status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
06795       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
06796          return status;
06797 
06798       if (key.type != TID_KEY) {
06799          /* copy single key */
06800          if (key.item_size * key.num_values != *buf_size) {
06801             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_record", "struct size mismatch for \"%s\"", key.name);
06802             return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
06803          }
06804 
06805          db_get_data(hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, key.type);
06806 
06807          if (convert_flags) {
06808             if (key.num_values > 1)
06809                rpc_convert_data(data, key.type,
06810                                 RPC_OUTGOING | RPC_FIXARRAY,
06811                                 key.item_size * key.num_values, convert_flags);
06812             else
06813                rpc_convert_single(data, key.type, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
06814          }
06815 
06816          return DB_SUCCESS;
06817       }
06818 
06819       /* check record size */
06820       db_get_record_size(hDB, hKey, 0, &total_size);
06821       if (total_size != *buf_size) {
06822          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
06823          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_record",
06824                 "struct size mismatch for \"%s\" (%d instead of %d)", str,
06825                 *buf_size, total_size);
06826          return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
06827       }
06828 
06829       /* get subkey data */
06830       pdata = data;
06831       total_size = 0;
06832 
06833       db_lock_database(hDB);
06834       db_recurse_record_tree(hDB, hKey, &pdata, &total_size, align,
06835                              NULL, FALSE, convert_flags);
06836       db_unlock_database(hDB);
06837 
06838    }
06839 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06840 
06841    return DB_SUCCESS;
06842 }
06843 
06844 /********************************************************************/
06874 INT db_set_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *data, INT buf_size, INT align)
06875 {
06876    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
06877       align = ss_get_struct_align();
06878       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_RECORD, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, align);
06879    }
06880 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06881    {
06882       KEY key;
06883       INT convert_flags;
06884       INT total_size;
06885       void *pdata;
06886 
06887       convert_flags = 0;
06888 
06889       if (!align)
06890          align = ss_get_struct_align();
06891       else
06892          /* only convert data if called remotely, as indicated by align != 0 */
06893       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
06894          convert_flags = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS);
06895 
06896       /* check if key has subkeys */
06897       db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
06898       if (key.type != TID_KEY) {
06899          /* copy single key */
06900          if (key.item_size * key.num_values != buf_size) {
06901             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_record", "struct size mismatch for \"%s\"", key.name);
06902             return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
06903          }
06904 
06905          if (convert_flags) {
06906             if (key.num_values > 1)
06907                rpc_convert_data(data, key.type, RPC_FIXARRAY,
06908                                 key.item_size * key.num_values, convert_flags);
06909             else
06910                rpc_convert_single(data, key.type, 0, convert_flags);
06911          }
06912 
06913          db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data, key.total_size, key.num_values, key.type);
06914          return DB_SUCCESS;
06915       }
06916 
06917       /* check record size */
06918       db_get_record_size(hDB, hKey, 0, &total_size);
06919       if (total_size != buf_size) {
06920          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_record", "struct size mismatch for \"%s\"", key.name);
06921          return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
06922       }
06923 
06924       /* set subkey data */
06925       pdata = data;
06926       total_size = 0;
06927 
06928       db_lock_database(hDB);
06929       db_recurse_record_tree(hDB, hKey, &pdata, &total_size, align,
06930                              NULL, TRUE, convert_flags);
06931       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
06932       db_unlock_database(hDB);
06933    }
06934 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06935 
06936    return DB_SUCCESS;
06937 }
06938 
06940 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
06941 
06942 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06943 INT db_add_open_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, WORD access_mode)
06944 /********************************************************************\
06945 
06946   Routine: db_add_open_record
06947 
06948   Purpose: Server part of db_open_record. Internal use only.
06949 
06950 \********************************************************************/
06951 {
06952    if (rpc_is_remote())
06953       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_ADD_OPEN_RECORD, hDB, hKey, access_mode);
06954 
06955 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06956    {
06957       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
06958       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
06959       KEY *pkey;
06960       INT i;
06961 
06962       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
06963          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_add_open_record", "invalid database handle");
06964          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
06965       }
06966 
06967       /* lock database */
06968       db_lock_database(hDB);
06969 
06970       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
06971       pclient = &pheader->client[_database[hDB - 1].client_index];
06972 
06973       /* check if key is already open */
06974       for (i = 0; i < pclient->max_index; i++)
06975          if (pclient->open_record[i].handle == hKey)
06976             break;
06977 
06978       if (i < pclient->max_index) {
06979          db_unlock_database(hDB);
06980          return DB_SUCCESS;
06981       }
06982 
06983       /* not found, search free entry */
06984       for (i = 0; i < pclient->max_index; i++)
06985          if (pclient->open_record[i].handle == 0)
06986             break;
06987 
06988       /* check if maximum number reached */
06989       if (i == MAX_OPEN_RECORDS) {
06990          db_unlock_database(hDB);
06991          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
06992       }
06993 
06994       if (i == pclient->max_index)
06995          pclient->max_index++;
06996 
06997       pclient->open_record[i].handle = hKey;
06998       pclient->open_record[i].access_mode = access_mode;
06999 
07000       /* increment notify_count */
07001       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
07002 
07003       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
07004       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
07005          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07006          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
07007       }
07008 
07009       pkey->notify_count++;
07010 
07011       pclient->num_open_records++;
07012 
07013       /* set exclusive bit if requested */
07014       if (access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
07015          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, (WORD) (pkey->access_mode | MODE_EXCLUSIVE), 2);
07016 
07017       db_unlock_database(hDB);
07018    }
07019 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07020 
07021    return DB_SUCCESS;
07022 }
07023 
07024 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
07025 INT db_remove_open_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, BOOL lock)
07026 /********************************************************************\
07027 
07028   Routine: db_remove_open_record
07029 
07030   Purpose: Gets called by db_close_record. Internal use only.
07031 
07032 \********************************************************************/
07033 {
07034    if (rpc_is_remote())
07035       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_REMOVE_OPEN_RECORD, hDB, hKey);
07036 
07037 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07038    {
07039       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
07040       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
07041       KEY *pkey;
07042       INT i, index;
07043 
07044       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
07045          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_remove_open_record", "invalid database handle");
07046          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
07047       }
07048 
07049       if (lock)
07050          db_lock_database(hDB);
07051 
07052       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
07053       pclient = &pheader->client[_database[hDB - 1].client_index];
07054 
07055       /* search key */
07056       for (index = 0; index < pclient->max_index; index++)
07057          if (pclient->open_record[index].handle == hKey)
07058             break;
07059 
07060       if (index == pclient->max_index) {
07061          if (lock)
07062             db_unlock_database(hDB);
07063 
07064          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
07065       }
07066 
07067       /* decrement notify_count */
07068       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
07069 
07070       if (pkey->notify_count > 0)
07071          pkey->notify_count--;
07072 
07073       pclient->num_open_records--;
07074 
07075       /* remove exclusive flag */
07076       if (pclient->open_record[index].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
07077          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, (WORD) (pkey->access_mode & ~MODE_EXCLUSIVE), 2);
07078 
07079       memset(&pclient->open_record[index], 0, sizeof(OPEN_RECORD));
07080 
07081       /* calculate new max_index entry */
07082       for (i = pclient->max_index - 1; i >= 0; i--)
07083          if (pclient->open_record[i].handle != 0)
07084             break;
07085       pclient->max_index = i + 1;
07086 
07087       if (lock)
07088          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07089    }
07090 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07091 
07092    return DB_SUCCESS;
07093 }
07094 
07095 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
07096 
07097 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07098 
07099 INT db_notify_clients(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, BOOL bWalk)
07100 /********************************************************************\
07101 
07102   Routine: db_notify_clients
07103 
07104   Purpose: Gets called by db_set_xxx functions. Internal use only.
07105 
07106 \********************************************************************/
07107 {
07108    DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
07109    DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
07110    KEY *pkey;
07111    KEYLIST *pkeylist;
07112    INT i, j;
07113    char str[80];
07114 
07115    if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
07116       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_notify_clients", "invalid database handle");
07117       return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
07118    }
07119 
07120    pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
07121 
07122    /* check if key or parent has notify_flag set */
07123    pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
07124 
07125    do {
07126 
07127       /* check which client has record open */
07128       if (pkey->notify_count)
07129          for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++) {
07130             pclient = &pheader->client[i];
07131             for (j = 0; j < pclient->max_index; j++)
07132                if (pclient->open_record[j].handle == hKey) {
07133                   /* send notification to remote process */
07134                   sprintf(str, "O %d %d", hDB, hKey);
07135                   ss_resume(pclient->port, str);
07136                }
07137          }
07138 
07139       if (pkey->parent_keylist == 0 || !bWalk)
07140          return DB_SUCCESS;
07141 
07142       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
07143       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
07144       hKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
07145    } while (TRUE);
07146 
07147 }
07148 
07149 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07150 
07151 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
07152 void merge_records(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, KEY * pkey, INT level, void *info)
07153 {
07154    char full_name[256], buffer[10000];
07155    INT status, size;
07156    HNDLE hKeyInit;
07157    KEY initkey, key;
07158 
07159    /* compose name of init key */
07160    db_get_path(hDB, hKey, full_name, sizeof(full_name));
07161    *strchr(full_name, 'O') = 'I';
07162 
07163    /* if key in init record found, copy original data to init data */
07164    status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, full_name, &hKeyInit);
07165    if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
07166       status = db_get_key(hDB, hKeyInit, &initkey);
07167       assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
07168       status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
07169       assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
07170 
07171       if (initkey.type != TID_KEY && initkey.type == key.type) {
07172          /* copy data from original key to new key */
07173          size = sizeof(buffer);
07174          status = db_get_data(hDB, hKey, buffer, &size, initkey.type);
07175          assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
07176          status =
07177              db_set_data(hDB, hKeyInit, buffer, initkey.total_size,
07178                          initkey.num_values, initkey.type);
07179          assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
07180       }
07181    } else if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
07182       /* do nothing */
07183    } else if (status == DB_INVALID_LINK) {
07184       status = db_find_link(hDB, 0, full_name, &hKeyInit);
07185       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
07186          size = sizeof(full_name);
07187          db_get_data(hDB, hKeyInit, full_name, &size, TID_LINK);
07188       }
07189       cm_msg(MERROR, "merge_records", "Invalid link \"%s\"", full_name);
07190    } else {
07191       cm_msg(MERROR, "merge_records",
07192              "aborting on unexpected failure of db_find_key(%s), status %d",
07193              full_name, status);
07194       abort();
07195    }
07196 }
07197 
07198 static int open_count;
07199 
07200 void check_open_keys(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, KEY * pkey, INT level, void *info)
07201 {
07202    if (pkey->notify_count)
07203       open_count++;
07204 }
07205 
07207 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
07208 
07209 /********************************************************************/
07266 INT db_create_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *orig_key_name, char *init_str)
07267 {
07268    char str[256], key_name[256], *buffer;
07269    INT status, size, i, buffer_size;
07270    HNDLE hKeyTmp, hKeyTmpO, hKeyOrig, hSubkey;
07271 
07272    if (rpc_is_remote())
07273       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_CREATE_RECORD, hDB, hKey, orig_key_name, init_str);
07274 
07275    /* make this function atomic */
07276    db_lock_database(hDB);
07277 
07278    /* strip trailing '/' */
07279    strlcpy(key_name, orig_key_name, sizeof(key_name));
07280    if (strlen(key_name) > 1 && key_name[strlen(key_name) - 1] == '/')
07281       key_name[strlen(key_name) - 1] = 0;
07282 
07283    /* merge temporay record and original record */
07284    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, key_name, &hKeyOrig);
07285    if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
07286       assert(hKeyOrig != 0);
07287       /* check if key or subkey is opened */
07288       open_count = 0;
07289       db_scan_tree_link(hDB, hKeyOrig, 0, check_open_keys, NULL);
07290       if (open_count) {
07291          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07292          return DB_OPEN_RECORD;
07293       }
07294 
07295       /* create temporary records */
07296       sprintf(str, "/System/Tmp/%1dI", ss_gettid());
07297       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKeyTmp);
07298       if (hKeyTmp)
07299          db_delete_key(hDB, hKeyTmp, FALSE);
07300       db_create_key(hDB, 0, str, TID_KEY);
07301       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKeyTmp);
07302       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07303          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07304          return status;
07305       }
07306 
07307       sprintf(str, "/System/Tmp/%1dO", ss_gettid());
07308       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKeyTmpO);
07309       if (hKeyTmpO)
07310          db_delete_key(hDB, hKeyTmpO, FALSE);
07311       db_create_key(hDB, 0, str, TID_KEY);
07312       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKeyTmpO);
07313       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07314          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07315          return status;
07316       }
07317 
07318       status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyTmp, init_str);
07319       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07320          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07321          return status;
07322       }
07323 
07324       buffer_size = 10000;
07325       buffer = (char *) malloc(buffer_size);
07326       do {
07327          size = buffer_size;
07328          status = db_copy(hDB, hKeyOrig, buffer, &size, "");
07329          if (status == DB_TRUNCATED) {
07330             buffer_size += 10000;
07331             buffer = (char *) realloc(buffer, buffer_size);
07332             continue;
07333          }
07334          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07335             db_unlock_database(hDB);
07336             return status;
07337          }
07338 
07339       } while (status != DB_SUCCESS);
07340 
07341       status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyTmpO, buffer);
07342       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07343          free(buffer);
07344          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07345          return status;
07346       }
07347 
07348       /* merge temporay record and original record */
07349       db_scan_tree_link(hDB, hKeyTmpO, 0, merge_records, NULL);
07350 
07351       /* delete original record */
07352       for (i = 0;; i++) {
07353          db_enum_link(hDB, hKeyOrig, 0, &hSubkey);
07354          if (!hSubkey)
07355             break;
07356 
07357          status = db_delete_key(hDB, hSubkey, FALSE);
07358          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07359             free(buffer);
07360             db_unlock_database(hDB);
07361             return status;
07362          }
07363       }
07364 
07365       /* copy merged record to original record */
07366       do {
07367          size = buffer_size;
07368          status = db_copy(hDB, hKeyTmp, buffer, &size, "");
07369          if (status == DB_TRUNCATED) {
07370             buffer_size += 10000;
07371             buffer = (char *) realloc(buffer, buffer_size);
07372             continue;
07373          }
07374          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07375             free(buffer);
07376             db_unlock_database(hDB);
07377             return status;
07378          }
07379 
07380       } while (status != DB_SUCCESS);
07381 
07382       status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyOrig, buffer);
07383       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07384          free(buffer);
07385          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07386          return status;
07387       }
07388 
07389       /* delete temporary records */
07390       db_delete_key(hDB, hKeyTmp, FALSE);
07391       db_delete_key(hDB, hKeyTmpO, FALSE);
07392 
07393       free(buffer);
07394    } else if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
07395       /* create fresh record */
07396       db_create_key(hDB, hKey, key_name, TID_KEY);
07397       status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, key_name, &hKeyTmp);
07398       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07399          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07400          return status;
07401       }
07402 
07403       status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyTmp, init_str);
07404       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07405          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07406          return status;
07407       }
07408    } else {
07409       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_record",
07410              "aborting on unexpected failure of db_find_key(%s), status %d",
07411              key_name, status);
07412       abort();
07413    }
07414 
07415    db_unlock_database(hDB);
07416 
07417    return DB_SUCCESS;
07418 }
07419 
07420 /********************************************************************/
07436 INT db_check_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, char *keyname, char *rec_str, BOOL correct)
07437 {
07438    char line[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
07439    char title[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
07440    char key_name[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
07441    char info_str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH + 50];
07442    char *pc, *pold, *rec_str_orig;
07443    DWORD tid;
07444    INT i, j, n_data, string_length, status;
07445    HNDLE hKeyRoot, hKeyTest;
07446    KEY key;
07447    BOOL multi_line;
07448 
07449    if (rpc_is_remote())
07450       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_CHECK_RECORD, hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str, correct);
07451 
07452    /* check if record exists */
07453    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, keyname, &hKeyRoot);
07454 
07455    /* create record if not */
07456    if (status == DB_NO_KEY)
07457       return db_create_record(hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str);
07458 
07459    assert(hKeyRoot);
07460 
07461    title[0] = 0;
07462    multi_line = FALSE;
07463    rec_str_orig = rec_str;
07464 
07465    db_get_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, &key);
07466    if (key.type == TID_KEY)
07467       /* get next subkey which is not of type TID_KEY */
07468       db_get_next_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, &hKeyTest);
07469    else
07470       /* test root key itself */
07471       hKeyTest = hKeyRoot;
07472 
07473    if (hKeyTest == 0 && *rec_str != 0) {
07474       if (correct)
07475          return db_create_record(hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str_orig);
07476 
07477       return DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH;
07478    }
07479 
07480    do {
07481       if (*rec_str == 0)
07482          break;
07483 
07484       for (i = 0; *rec_str != '\n' && *rec_str && i < MAX_STRING_LENGTH; i++)
07485          line[i] = *rec_str++;
07486 
07487       if (i == MAX_STRING_LENGTH) {
07488          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_check_record", "line too long");
07489          return DB_TRUNCATED;
07490       }
07491 
07492       line[i] = 0;
07493       if (*rec_str == '\n')
07494          rec_str++;
07495 
07496       /* check if it is a section title */
07497       if (line[0] == '[') {
07498          /* extract title and append '/' */
07499          strcpy(title, line + 1);
07500          if (strchr(title, ']'))
07501             *strchr(title, ']') = 0;
07502          if (title[0] && title[strlen(title) - 1] != '/')
07503             strcat(title, "/");
07504       } else {
07505          /* valid data line if it includes '=' and no ';' */
07506          if (strchr(line, '=') && line[0] != ';') {
07507             /* copy type info and data */
07508             pc = strchr(line, '=') + 1;
07509             while (*pc == ' ')
07510                pc++;
07511             strcpy(info_str, pc);
07512 
07513             /* extract key name */
07514             *strchr(line, '=') = 0;
07515 
07516             pc = &line[strlen(line) - 1];
07517             while (*pc == ' ')
07518                *pc-- = 0;
07519 
07520             key_name[0] = 0;
07521             if (title[0] != '.')
07522                strcpy(key_name, title);
07523 
07524             strcat(key_name, line);
07525 
07526             /* evaluate type info */
07527             strcpy(line, info_str);
07528             if (strchr(line, ' '))
07529                *strchr(line, ' ') = 0;
07530 
07531             n_data = 1;
07532             if (strchr(line, '[')) {
07533                n_data = atol(strchr(line, '[') + 1);
07534                *strchr(line, '[') = 0;
07535             }
07536 
07537             for (tid = 0; tid < TID_LAST; tid++)
07538                if (strcmp(tid_name[tid], line) == 0)
07539                   break;
07540 
07541             string_length = 0;
07542 
07543             if (tid == TID_LAST)
07544                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_check_record",
07545                       "found unknown data type \"%s\" in ODB file", line);
07546             else {
07547                /* skip type info */
07548                pc = info_str;
07549                while (*pc != ' ' && *pc)
07550                   pc++;
07551                while ((*pc == ' ' || *pc == ':') && *pc)
07552                   pc++;
07553 
07554                if (n_data > 1) {
07555                   info_str[0] = 0;
07556                   if (!*rec_str)
07557                      break;
07558 
07559                   for (j = 0; *rec_str != '\n' && *rec_str; j++)
07560                      info_str[j] = *rec_str++;
07561                   info_str[j] = 0;
07562                   if (*rec_str == '\n')
07563                      rec_str++;
07564                }
07565 
07566                for (i = 0; i < n_data; i++) {
07567                   /* strip trailing \n */
07568                   pc = &info_str[strlen(info_str) - 1];
07569                   while (*pc == '\n' || *pc == '\r')
07570                      *pc-- = 0;
07571 
07572                   if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK) {
07573                      if (!string_length) {
07574                         if (info_str[1] == '=')
07575                            string_length = -1;
07576                         else
07577                            string_length = atoi(info_str + 1);
07578                         if (string_length > MAX_STRING_LENGTH) {
07579                            string_length = MAX_STRING_LENGTH;
07580                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_check_record",
07581                                   "found string exceeding MAX_STRING_LENGTH");
07582                         }
07583                      }
07584 
07585                      if (string_length == -1) {
07586                         /* multi-line string */
07587                         if (strstr(rec_str, "\n====#$@$#====\n") != NULL) {
07588                            string_length =
07589                                (PTYPE) strstr(rec_str,
07590                                               "\n====#$@$#====\n") - (PTYPE) rec_str + 1;
07591 
07592                            rec_str =
07593                                strstr(rec_str,
07594                                       "\n====#$@$#====\n") + strlen("\n====#$@$#====\n");
07595                         } else
07596                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_check_record",
07597                                   "found multi-line string without termination sequence");
07598                      } else {
07599                         pc = info_str + 2;
07600                         while (*pc && *pc != ' ')
07601                            pc++;
07602                         while (*pc && *pc == ' ')
07603                            pc++;
07604 
07605                         /* limit string size */
07606                         *(pc + string_length - 1) = 0;
07607                      }
07608                   } else {
07609                      pc = info_str;
07610 
07611                      if (n_data > 1 && info_str[0] == '[') {
07612                         pc = strchr(info_str, ']') + 1;
07613                         while (*pc && *pc == ' ')
07614                            pc++;
07615                      }
07616                   }
07617 
07618                   if (i < n_data - 1) {
07619                      info_str[0] = 0;
07620                      if (!*rec_str)
07621                         break;
07622 
07623                      pold = rec_str;
07624 
07625                      for (j = 0; *rec_str != '\n' && *rec_str; j++)
07626                         info_str[j] = *rec_str++;
07627                      info_str[j] = 0;
07628                      if (*rec_str == '\n')
07629                         rec_str++;
07630 
07631                      /* test if valid data */
07632                      if (tid != TID_STRING && tid != TID_LINK) {
07633                         if (info_str[0] == 0 || (strchr(info_str, '=')
07634                                                  && strchr(info_str, ':')))
07635                            rec_str = pold;
07636                      }
07637                   }
07638                }
07639 
07640                /* if rec_str contains key, but not ODB, return mismatch */
07641                if (!hKeyTest) {
07642                   if (correct)
07643                      return db_create_record(hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str_orig);
07644 
07645                   return DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH;
07646                }
07647 
07648                status = db_get_key(hDB, hKeyTest, &key);
07649                assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
07650 
07651                /* check rec_str vs. ODB key */
07652                if (!equal_ustring(key.name, key_name) ||
07653                    key.type != tid || key.num_values != n_data) {
07654                   if (correct)
07655                      return db_create_record(hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str_orig);
07656 
07657                   return DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH;
07658                }
07659 
07660                /* get next key in ODB */
07661                db_get_next_link(hDB, hKeyTest, &hKeyTest);
07662             }
07663          }
07664       }
07665    } while (TRUE);
07666 
07667    return DB_SUCCESS;
07668 }
07669 
07670 /********************************************************************/
07741 INT db_open_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *ptr, INT rec_size,
07742                    WORD access_mode, void (*dispatcher) (INT, INT, void *), void *info)
07743 {
07744    INT index, status, size;
07745    KEY key;
07746    void *data;
07747    char str[256];
07748 
07749    /* allocate new space for the local record list */
07750    if (_record_list_entries == 0) {
07751       _record_list = (RECORD_LIST *) malloc(sizeof(RECORD_LIST));
07752       memset(_record_list, 0, sizeof(RECORD_LIST));
07753       if (_record_list == NULL) {
07754          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "not enough memory");
07755          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07756       }
07757 
07758       _record_list_entries = 1;
07759       index = 0;
07760    } else {
07761       /* check for a deleted entry */
07762       for (index = 0; index < _record_list_entries; index++)
07763          if (!_record_list[index].handle)
07764             break;
07765 
07766       /* if not found, create new one */
07767       if (index == _record_list_entries) {
07768          _record_list = (RECORD_LIST *) realloc(_record_list,
07769                                                 sizeof(RECORD_LIST) *
07770                                                 (_record_list_entries + 1));
07771          if (_record_list == NULL) {
07772             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "not enough memory");
07773             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07774          }
07775 
07776          memset(&_record_list[_record_list_entries], 0, sizeof(RECORD_LIST));
07777 
07778          _record_list_entries++;
07779       }
07780    }
07781 
07782    db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
07783 
07784    /* check record size */
07785    status = db_get_record_size(hDB, hKey, 0, &size);
07786    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07787       _record_list_entries--;
07788       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "cannot get record size");
07789       return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07790    }
07791    if (size != rec_size && ptr != NULL) {
07792       _record_list_entries--;
07793       db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
07794       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record",
07795              "struct size mismatch for \"%s\" (%d instead of %d)", str, rec_size, size);
07796       return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
07797    }
07798 
07799    /* check for read access */
07800    if (((key.access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE) && (access_mode & MODE_WRITE))
07801        || (!(key.access_mode & MODE_WRITE) && (access_mode & MODE_WRITE))
07802        || (!(key.access_mode & MODE_READ) && (access_mode & MODE_READ))) {
07803       _record_list_entries--;
07804       return DB_NO_ACCESS;
07805    }
07806 
07807    if (access_mode & MODE_ALLOC) {
07808       data = malloc(size);
07809       memset(data, 0, size);
07810 
07811       if (data == NULL) {
07812          _record_list_entries--;
07813          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "not enough memory");
07814          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07815       }
07816 
07817       *((void **) ptr) = data;
07818    } else
07819       data = ptr;
07820 
07821    /* copy record to local memory */
07822    if (access_mode & MODE_READ && data != NULL) {
07823       status = db_get_record(hDB, hKey, data, &size, 0);
07824       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07825          _record_list_entries--;
07826          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "cannot get record");
07827          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07828       }
07829    }
07830 
07831    /* copy local record to ODB */
07832    if (access_mode & MODE_WRITE) {
07833       /* only write to ODB if not in MODE_ALLOC */
07834       if ((access_mode & MODE_ALLOC) == 0) {
07835          status = db_set_record(hDB, hKey, data, size, 0);
07836          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07837             _record_list_entries--;
07838             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "cannot set record");
07839             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07840          }
07841       }
07842 
07843       /* init a local copy of the record */
07844       _record_list[index].copy = malloc(size);
07845       if (_record_list[index].copy == NULL) {
07846          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "not enough memory");
07847          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07848       }
07849 
07850       memcpy(_record_list[index].copy, data, size);
07851    }
07852 
07853    /* initialize record list */
07854    _record_list[index].handle = hKey;
07855    _record_list[index].hDB = hDB;
07856    _record_list[index].access_mode = access_mode;
07857    _record_list[index].data = data;
07858    _record_list[index].buf_size = size;
07859    _record_list[index].dispatcher = dispatcher;
07860    _record_list[index].info = info;
07861 
07862    /* add record entry in database structure */
07863    db_add_open_record(hDB, hKey, (WORD) (access_mode & ~MODE_ALLOC));
07864 
07865    return DB_SUCCESS;
07866 }
07867 
07868 /********************************************************************/
07875 INT db_close_record(HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey)
07876 {
07877 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
07878    {
07879       INT i;
07880 
07881       for (i = 0; i < _record_list_entries; i++)
07882          if (_record_list[i].handle == hKey && _record_list[i].hDB == hDB)
07883             break;
07884 
07885       if (i == _record_list_entries)
07886          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
07887 
07888       /* remove record entry from database structure */
07889       db_remove_open_record(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
07890 
07891       /* free local memory */
07892       if (_record_list[i].access_mode & MODE_ALLOC)
07893          free(_record_list[i].data);
07894 
07895       if (_record_list[i].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
07896          free(_record_list[i].copy);
07897 
07898       memset(&_record_list[i], 0, sizeof(RECORD_LIST));
07899    }
07900 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07901 
07902    return DB_SUCCESS;
07903 }
07904 
07905 /********************************************************************/
07912 INT db_close_all_records()
07913 {
07914    INT i;
07915 
07916    for (i = 0; i < _record_list_entries; i++) {
07917       if (_record_list[i].handle) {
07918          if (_record_list[i].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
07919             free(_record_list[i].copy);
07920 
07921          if (_record_list[i].access_mode & MODE_ALLOC)
07922             free(_record_list[i].data);
07923 
07924          memset(&_record_list[i], 0, sizeof(RECORD_LIST));
07925       }
07926    }
07927 
07928    if (_record_list_entries > 0) {
07929       _record_list_entries = 0;
07930       free(_record_list);
07931    }
07932 
07933    return DB_SUCCESS;
07934 }
07935 
07936 /********************************************************************/
07947 INT db_update_record(INT hDB, INT hKey, int socket)
07948 {
07949    INT i, size, convert_flags, status;
07950    char buffer[32];
07951    NET_COMMAND *nc;
07952 
07953    /* check if we are the server */
07954    if (socket) {
07955       convert_flags = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS);
07956 
07957       if (convert_flags & CF_ASCII) {
07958          sprintf(buffer, "MSG_ODB&%d&%d", hDB, hKey);
07959          send_tcp(socket, buffer, strlen(buffer) + 1, 0);
07960       } else {
07961          nc = (NET_COMMAND *) buffer;
07962 
07963          nc->header.routine_id = MSG_ODB;
07964          nc->header.param_size = 2 * sizeof(INT);
07965          *((INT *) nc->param) = hDB;
07966          *((INT *) nc->param + 1) = hKey;
07967 
07968          if (convert_flags) {
07969             rpc_convert_single(&nc->header.routine_id, TID_DWORD,
07970                                RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
07971             rpc_convert_single(&nc->header.param_size, TID_DWORD,
07972                                RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
07973             rpc_convert_single(&nc->param[0], TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
07974             rpc_convert_single(&nc->param[4], TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
07975          }
07976 
07977          /* send the update notification to the client */
07978          send_tcp(socket, buffer, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + 2 * sizeof(INT), 0);
07979       }
07980 
07981       return DB_SUCCESS;
07982    }
07983 
07984    status = DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
07985 
07986    /* check all entries for matching key */
07987    for (i = 0; i < _record_list_entries; i++)
07988       if (_record_list[i].handle == hKey) {
07989          status = DB_SUCCESS;
07990 
07991          /* get updated data if record not opened in write mode */
07992          if ((_record_list[i].access_mode & MODE_WRITE) == 0) {
07993             size = _record_list[i].buf_size;
07994             if (_record_list[i].data != NULL)
07995                db_get_record(hDB, hKey, _record_list[i].data, &size, 0);
07996 
07997             /* call dispatcher if requested */
07998             if (_record_list[i].dispatcher)
07999                _record_list[i].dispatcher(hDB, hKey, _record_list[i].info);
08000          }
08001       }
08002 
08003    return DB_SUCCESS;
08004 }
08005 
08006 /********************************************************************/
08155 INT db_send_changed_records()
08156 {
08157    INT i;
08158 
08159    for (i = 0; i < _record_list_entries; i++)
08160       if (_record_list[i].access_mode & MODE_WRITE) {
08161          if (memcmp
08162              (_record_list[i].copy, _record_list[i].data,
08163               _record_list[i].buf_size) != 0) {
08164             /* switch to fast TCP mode temporarily */
08165             if (rpc_is_remote())
08166                rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_FTCP);
08167             db_set_record(_record_list[i].hDB,
08168                           _record_list[i].handle,
08169                           _record_list[i].data, _record_list[i].buf_size, 0);
08170             if (rpc_is_remote())
08171                rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_TCP);
08172             memcpy(_record_list[i].copy, _record_list[i].data, _record_list[i].buf_size);
08173          }
08174       }
08175 
08176    return DB_SUCCESS;
08177 }
